ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!CRYPT OF THE ARCHONS!0..dialogue_text: MULTICHECKER

Bones and sinew weave a new shell as they are rebuilt from the life-fire of the ether. Ormenos now stands upon a copper disk in a dusty chamber where he is confronted with the cold, glaring eyes of scores of Thiudan Neverborn. Though the Enclavean Brother has seen their ilk many times before, Ormenos remains unnerved by the motionless sentries. Their scores of lines seem to fade away, gobbled up by the impenetrable murk at their backs.

Turning around, Ormenos soon sees the lone rebel in this pit of darkness, the sole source of pale, pulsating light in this ruinous abyss. He sees the roots of a massive Muninn. Its determined glow radiates out into the inky void, slowly dying the further it ventures from the origin. The trunk reaches skyward, likewise disappearing somewhere in this sea of absence.

        The tree's light also falls on the miscellany of this space. Illuminating relics from the exodus of Thiuda as they lay scattered about, three to every Neverborn at least. Some on desks equally ancient, others on shelves, and still some too large to be housed in any casing.

		Though numerous the relics may be, only two objects truly tug at Ormenos' attention. One is a judgment dais, similar to the one in the Hall of Reckoning, he notes, with the only difference being the charred circle decorating its base - shadows they cannot be, for the neither hum nor buzz when the Muninn's light wavers. The second is simpler, and perhaps less grim: an altar, with several lit candles atop it.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!CRYPT OF THE ARCHONS!00.dialogue_text: Shock and confusion compete for his attention. For though filled with trepidation, with utter terror, he somehow still feels compelled to stand upon the dais...
Incredulously, he advances towards it; reluctantly, he steps upon it.

A blinding light cascades down from the ceiling, showering his form in rays of the purest white and forcing the sharpness of surrounding objects far into the shadowy background. He now sees nothing but the pillar of light in which he stands. He brings his hands up to his eyes, yet even they are invisible to him. Closer, closer, ever-closer, he keeps halving the distance, over and over, yet never reaching his face.
Uncertain. Afraid. Alone. He stands surrounded by an all-consuming light, this in turn surrounded by an insatiable darkness. He wants to shriek, but fear strangles the sound into a pathetic squeal.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!CRYPT OF THE ARCHONS!0..dialogue_text: Then, shattering the silence like distant thunder - the awful prelude to nature's fury - the voice of a Thought Wheel, captures Ormenos' undivided attention.

Executors final words echo out across the chamber, each dying repetition seeming to heat the room. Soon, bubbles of air form beneath Ormenos' skin, bursting when they exceed capacity. Blood evaporates instantly upon contact with the air. Muscles begin to melt and bones dissolve, yet somehow he feels no pain - a small mercy.

Ormenos could not extract the secrets of the ancients from the realm of the unknown. He is no more. But the chaos that directed this vessel returns again to the Eternal Spiral, simply waiting to be spun once more into the tapestry of Falseflesh...
~ac

D.response_text: EIDOS

E.response_text: WULFIAS

F.response_text: EIDOS

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!CRYPT OF THE ARCHONS!0..dialogue_text: Worthy, but for what cause? Ormenos has no dearth of knowledge, but he finds himself now lacking in awareness - for he has only the slightest of inklings as to the significance of what he has just accomplished...

Light inundates the chamber as the once listless Neverborn now so brightly burn with the fire of purpose. In unison they turn, saluting their commander with their silent approval. Yet, in this timeless moment of sublime bewilderment, Ormenos barely notices the walls parting behind the sentries, a tunnel burrowing into the unknown depths of the Enclave beyond.
He cannot explain why, but every fiber of his being now warns him against entering this abyssal path to truth - for sights once seen can never be forgotten.

Even in the grips of terror, at the edge of madness, Ormenos still moves forward. Possessed by some unknown will, he draws up the strength to enter the tenebrous chasm, and slowly it swallows him, ghost and all.

At the edge of madness, Ormenos reels in fear from the tenebrous chasm. This instinct is what has kept him alive during his horrifying investigations. It is what helped him survive some of the most perverse minds the Enclave has ever detained for Thought Draining. He knows, this is why he is so good at what he does.
Giving himself over to instinct, he runs for his life, time and space blurring as his Falseflesh flies to safety. Ormenos will not come out again, not until his body finds safety.

The cheerful mage reaches the Crypt of the Archons right as he finishes whistling the tune for the hundredth time - or was it the thousandth? In any event, it took him a long time to go a short way. In that time, he had many adventures, like when he slayed a cavern full of gremlins, or when he got Roostor drunk - not a good idea to get a god drunk, as it turns out! But time has come for him to return to the Enclave. To return to... by Roostor's comb! He's gotta fulfill his dream of caring for a herd of cows and become a cowherd! Oh, wait, not that... The word is 'coward'. He's gotta become a coward! In 3... 2... 1...

Cautiously, Ormenos approaches the strange altar. Six digits rise skyward from the a giant palm of solid onyx, curving inwards at their tips. Cloudy jade fingernails each host candles burning with undying and unflinching flames. Red wax flows down the nails' gentle slopes, dripping towards the palm, but vanishing before ever reaching it.\n\n\t\tJust who or what this altar venerates is uncertain, but whatever the object of worship may be, it was likely invaluable to the Order's Thiudan ancestors. The very fact that any religious rites or altars exist in their fiercely materialistic civilization speaks volumes to how highly they must have valued it.

Confusion, disillusion, consternation and myriad other perturbing emotions tug at the threads of Ormenos' sanity. He is not ready for the abhorrent secrets this dark place holds. Indeed, merely remaining in the maddening silence of this chamber threatens to unravel the mage's wits.

F.response_text: Inspect the room once more...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!CRYPT OF THE ARCHONS!0..dialogue_text: Ormenos turns his attention once more to the adumbral chamber. This time the sparkle of a ruby embedded into the base of the altar catches his eye. Though originally invisible to Ormenos, from this very specific perspective it welcomes sight. The inquisitive mage briefly forgets his apprehension and leans in to examine it more closely. It is a memory crystal, raw and incompatible with a Muninn. He would need a Vanquished reading device to decipher its contents, a device only the grovekeepers guard jealously...

Disappointment gives way to anxiety as Ormenos recalls the bizarre circumstances that brought him here. He scrambles to the Nearcaster, ready to flee. Trembling knees beg him to leave, but curiosity stalls the decision.

Ormenos turns his attention once more to the adumbral chamber. This time the sparkle of a ruby embedded into the base of the altar catches his eye. Though originally invisible to Ormenos, from this very specific perspective it welcomes sight. The inquisitive mage briefly forgets his apprehension and leans in to examine it more closely. It is a memory crystal, raw and incompatible with a Muninn. He would need a Vanquished reading device to decipher its contents, a device only the grovekeepers guard jealously...

Yet, something is different... something strange. A presence, a force, some beastly creature within him hungers. On the brink of starvation he feels like screaming, like howling. He longs to absorb the crystal's essence right into his Trueflesh. He yearns to forget the pain of this hunger, though he knows this will not cure it. Only one prey will sate him, but until then, this meager meal will have to suffice.

From the depths of the Graylands a Glyph materializes. Gracefully loping from the shadows into the forefront of awareness, Ormenos recognizes the Glyph of Extraction made form. The fog seems to coalesce into memory, bringing with it awareness. Though he knows not why, Ormenos remembers Fenrir; he remembers their pact, made in forgotten eras with characters beyond Ormenos' ken. Fenrir has come to honor their covenant by consuming the crystal's energy and leaving bare its contents.

Ormenos' Trueflesh crawls with the crystal's memories. Battles centuries old, an exodus, a new beginning, death, struggle, hope. A silent war rages on, as it has ever since the fall of the Vanquished, Biracul and the Masters on opposing sides, the Enclave somehow caught in the middle.
All his life, Ormenos has pursued knowledge and, above all else, truth. But for the first time, he begins to regret walking this path.

Ormenos turns his attention once more to the adumbral chamber. Eyes immediately search for the ruby he emptied. Its memories resonate with his Trueflesh, sympathetic threads whispering across the fabric of time.\n\n\t\tBut as attractive as the familiar may be, what is already known holds little sway over the inquisitive mage's attention. Discipline will help light his path through the shadows of ignorance; Discipline will wring knowledge from those who seek to cast shadows; Discipline will free Ormenos from fear... This has always been his hope.

Casting his gaze about, he sees relics from the exodus of Thiuda scattered around the room, three to every Neverborn sentry, at least. Some on desks equally ancient, others on shelves, and still some too large to be housed in any casing.\n\n\t\tThough numerous the relics may be, only two objects truly tug at Ormenos' attention. One is a judgment dais, similar to the one in the Hall of Reckoning, he notes, with the only difference being the circle of bones decorating this one's base. The second is simpler, and perhaps less grim: an altar, with several lit candles atop it.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!CRYPT OF THE ARCHONS!1..dialogue_text: Bones and sinew weave two shells as they are rebuilt from the life-fire of the ether. Ormenos and the Prime Archon rematerialize upon a copper disk in a dusty chamber where the magi are confronted with the cold, glaring eyes of scores of Thiudan Neverborn. Though the Enclavean Brother has seen their ilk many times before, Ormenos remains unnerved by the motionless sentries. Their scores of lines seem to fade away, gobbled up by the impenetrable murk at their backs.

Turning around, Ormenos soon sees the lone rebel in this pit of darkness, the sole source of pale, pulsating light in this ruinous abyss. He sees the roots of a massive Muninn. Its determined glow radiates out into the inky void, slowly dying the further it ventures from the origin. The trunk reaches skyward, likewise disappearing somewhere in this sea of absence.

        The tree's light also falls on the miscellany of this space. Illuminating relics from the exodus of Thiuda as they lay scattered about, three to every Neverborn at least. Some on desks equally ancient, others on shelves, and still some too large to be housed in any casing.

		Though numerous the relics may be, only two objects truly tug at Ormenos' attention. One is a judgment dais, similar to the one in the Hall of Reckoning, he notes, with the only difference being the charred circle decorating its base - shadows they cannot be, for the neither hum nor buzz when the Muninn's light wavers. The second is simpler, and perhaps less grim: an altar, with several lit candles atop it.

Eyes then desperately search for the man who brought him here. Movement among the shadows traces the form of Babel as he walks toward the dais. Twisted words seem to echo through the darkness, distorted into the nightmarish speech of delirium.

Light inundates the chamber as the once listless Neverborn now brightly burn with the fire of purpose. In unison they turn, saluting their commander with their silent rigidity. In this timeless moment of confusion, Ormenos barely notices the walls parting behind the sentries, where beyond them a tunnel burrows into the unknown depths of the Enclave.

He cannot explain why, but every fiber of his being now warns against entering this abyssal path - for sights once seen can never be forgotten. However, Babel now calmly walks down into the maw of madness, motioning Ormenos to follow...
With a knowing smile, the Prime Archon acknowledges the fear in Ormenos' eyes; his point has been made.

Soon the words of a forbidden incantation dance on Babel's tongue. The world becomes unfocused, shapes and colors bleeding into one another. Brilliant lights from an unfinished Glyph start to carve lines through the air. All senses dull; all tension releases; and eyelids soon feel the pull of gravity even before the Glyph is complete.
Never has he felt so helpless.
Never has he...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!CRYPT OF THE ARCHONS!0..dialogue_text: "What you have sought, Brother Inquisitor, now lies before you. But have you the eyes to see it?"
"Executor, I am as Archon. I demand passage into the Refuge."
"That I shall, Executor."
"Come now Ormenos, we mustn't keep the 'truth' waiting!"
MULTICHECKER
"Babel, as Prime Archon seen."
"The Choir's song opens the gates,\n\t\tTo the Zero Archon. To the Sylvan Refuge."
"Go. Seek the Emerald Architect's wisdom."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!CRYPT OF THE ARCHONS!1..dialogue_text: "Ormenos, as Brother seen.\n\t\tMay be unworthy among magi as Archon.\n\t\tRikharr's question will decide."
"Worth is proven.\n\t\tHere arrived due to ingenuity."
"Not enough.\n\t\tAwareness, indispensable to Archons."
"Show your learning..."

"Three born of His mind, to the blind God control.
		The first upon birth howled a clarion cry,
		So loud, with such force, it split the night sky.
		Hear her words; say her name; make the parts whole!

        'Of myriad states, I alone reign supreme,
		Directing Time's arrow to chaos' dream.
		Arrange as you will, I still win in the end,
		When shattered, the pieces cannot the whole mend!

        'Struggle or not, it is all the same,
		Quickly now, say it! What is my name?!'"

"The second one from the ether was pressed.
		Coiling the Earth, he kept all restrained.
		Compressing, deforming, yet goal unattained.
		Hear his words; say his name; this is your test!

		'None are safe, not God nor Man; encircled round,
		Their truest of Trueflesh by my body bound.
		Constricting, confining, breath stolen, soon gone,
		I tighten, I squeeze, no escape from my brawn!

        'Helpless, unmoving, forever tame,
		Quickly now, say it! What is my name?!"

"The third, as of yet remains but a thought.
		Though the Architect's mind holds clear its task,
		To contain the blind God in an unbreakable cask.
		Hear his words; say his name; find what is sought!

        'My devouring maw will gnaw and consume.
		My belly, for countless ghosts, serves as a tomb.
		A prison absent walls, no window, no door.
		Once in, I will act as your shell evermore.

        'Living, though dead, extinguished your flame.
		Quickly now, say it! What is my name?!"
"Ormenos, as Prime Archon seen.\n        Worthy found. By duty bound.\n\t\tRise now. Hear the chant."
"The Choir's song opens the gates.\n\t\tTo the Zero Archon. To the Sylvan Refuge."
"Go. As the new Prime Archon, Go.\n\t\tSeek the Emerald Architect's wisdom."
"Archon Marduk's cycles have ceased.\n\t\tThe Choir awaits his ascension!"

"The second one from the ether was pressed.
		Coiling the Earth, he kept all restrained.
		Compressing, deforming, yet goal unattained.
		Hear his words; say his name; this is your test!

		'None are safe, not God nor Man; encircled round,
		Their truest of Trueflesh by my body bound.
		Constricting, confining, breath stolen, soon gone,
		I tighten, I squeeze, no escape from my brawn!

        'Helpless, unmoving, forever tame,
		Quickly now, say it! What is my name?!"

"The third, as of yet remains but a thought.
		Though the Architect's mind holds clear its task,
		To contain the blind God in an unbreakable cask.
		Hear his words; say his name; find what is sought!

        'My devouring maw will gnaw and consume.
		My belly, for countless ghosts, serves as a tomb.
		A prison absent walls, no window, no door.
		Once in, I will act as your shell evermore.

        'Living, though dead, extinguished your flame.
		Quickly now, say it! What is my name?!"
"Ormenos, as impostor seen."
"Ignorance belies your confidence.\n\t\tNo Archon can you be."

"Here you stand.
        The Choir's eyes see nothing.
		Soon, as the Vanquished are,
        So too will you be."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.000!DESC.dialogue_text: Ormenos squints as tears blur his vision. Entering the grove from the darkness of the halls is no less than stepping into a midday summer from a wintry midnight. Light burns his eyes, tormenting him like an unwanted truth. Myriad crystals here ensure that light is in no short supply, as they droop from Huginn branches like ripened fruits. But where there is light there are also shadows, the ever-present promise that the light will wane. The shadows shift, however, with the movement of crystals being carefully transported between the trees.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!00.001!DES.dialogue_text: A sudden draft brings with it a light smoky scent mixed with the dust from metallic filings. Broken and discarded tree limbs shine with an unnatural luster revealing the metal's source. Several Architects seem to be attempting to repair the broken trees, but given the mounds of shattered Huginn branches surrounding them, they seem to be encountering difficulties.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!00.002!DES.dialogue_text: Several other Architects pluck ripened crystals from their boughs, carefully inspecting their status. These magi belong to the newest caste of the Enclavean Order. They are responsible for the search of lost arts of the Thiuda and their Vanquished predecessors. The upstarts have made giant strides toward remembering methods for Writing Glyphs, the rediscovery of casters - both far and near - as well as the instantaneous acquisition and apprehension of foreign Techne.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!00.X003!DE.dialogue_text: The Curator of the Architects is close-by, overseeing the unusual practices and rites of the magi in the Huginn Grove.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!000.003!DE.dialogue_text: The Curator of the Architects is close-by, overseeing the unusual practices and rites of the magi in the Huginn Grove. Ormenos then recalls this Curator's recent locking of horns with the Muninn Grove's Curator, bringing a involuntary curl to his lips. However, he soon recomposes himself to a presentable state.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.X001!DES.dialogue_text: Ormenos approaches the Curator, but she quickly anticipates his intentions to speak.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0010!DES.dialogue_text: The conversation at its terminus, the Form Forger coldly turns and walks into the grove without so much as casting a second glance back towards Ormenos.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.002!DESC.dialogue_text: The inquisitive mage begins to stroll through the supernatural grove, admiring the fantastic and variegated fruits of the Huginn trees. Though this is certainly not his first time here, he nonetheless remains in awe of the immensity of this underground grove. The chamber extends so far back that the halos of distant light seem to bleed into one another, choking out any shadows between the trees. Likewise, the ceiling is a distant sea of radiance, consuming magi riding Cloudstones up into its heights. The Cloudstones shrink to the size of a pebble before completely disappearing.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0020!DES.dialogue_text: After some time, Ormenos stumbles upon a clearing filled with workstations, clearly fashioned from decommissioned trees. Groups of magi slave away in a feverish trance as they work to rediscover the secrets of the ancients.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0021!DES.dialogue_text: He sees many masterful works of artifice being dismantled and meticulously studied. On one table, he spots a recently discovered device in the desert region of Outer Sunargund; this one reads and executes Techne stored within crystals, almost like a shifting Sigil. Another table, illuminated by the fruits of an enormous Huginn, holds an item which is purported to instantaneously, albeit temporarily, weave a Glyph upon a mage's Trueflesh. This particular device is said to have been known to the Okumi for centuries, but only came to the attention of the Enclave when the a Senior Thought-Weaver observed its use in one of the Wayfarer's many memories.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.X0022!DE.dialogue_text: But, Ormenos knows that most of these artifacts confound and even defy his erudition. There are blackened mirrors displaying spectral images of hidden dimensions. There are schematics displayed from the fiery tongue of a display lamp, a loping wolf dancing in its flames. And perhaps most out of place in its subdued and unassuming appearance is a collection of scattered stones with arrows etched into them, resting next to a minuscule metallic disk. Hovering over them like starving buzzards are two magi, fastidiously toying with the ruined artifact.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0023!DES.dialogue_text: Though there is nothing here that truly grabs his attention. Perhaps he is unobservant and ignorant; he looks, but he does not see. Or perhaps he has simply learned all he can from this place.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0024!DES.dialogue_text: The magi pore over the artifact, pecking at it from time to time, rearranging it into various configurations and replacing the metallic cap to the unenthusiastic whirring and fizzling sounds of an impotent machine attempting to revive itself.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0025!DES.dialogue_text: Suddenly, one of the unkempt duo appears to have been blessed with an epiphany. Arrange all arrows to point upwards in the direction of the metal disk first, he then replaces the cap.\n\n\t\tThe whir begins, but this time intensifying into a consistent purr and finally into sounds accompanying images of the ancients...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0026!DES.dialogue_text: ...in the process of... making children - or at least attempting very frenziedly to do so.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0027!DES.dialogue_text: At this point the magi who assembled the device discreetly make their exit, leaving the unfiltered passion of the Vanquished to crescendo unimpeded. The sounds grow so loud that all are forced to stop their work immediately to try to figure out how to turn it off. The magi would take a hammer to it, but any fool knows how volatile energetic crystals are when met with concussive force.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0028!DES.dialogue_text: At long last, they find the mechanism by which the volume operates and mute the sounds, leaving the images to run their course. Thankfully for those in attendance, it seems this particular pair of ancients were of the swift variety.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.X000!FOR.dialogue_text: "Greetings, Brother Inquisitor. How may I assist you?"

A.response_text: "I was wondering what you were researching recently."

C.response_text: "Actually, I'm rather aimless at the moment."

D.response_text: "What benefits would the secrets of the Vanquished bring?"

E.response_text: "Only the weak need assistance."

F.response_text: "Looks like there's a lot to loot here! Best get started!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.001!FORM.dialogue_text: "We have numerous research projects running concurrently. Notable among them are the work done on crystal reparation, Glyph Writing, Glyph conduits, and disassembly of other miscellaneous Vanquished or Thiudan apparatuses."

A.response_text: "You sure keep yourselves busy here, Sister."

E.response_text: "Many projects, but no results..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.002!FORM.dialogue_text: "Most noteworthy would be the advancements in crystal repair: we can now seal superficial cracks on a crystal's exterior."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0020!FOR.dialogue_text: "We've also had some progress with Nearcasting. But only in that we discovered certain patterns within the seal that may be related to the Techne."

A.response_text: "Superb! I hope to hear of more achievements soon!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.003!FORM.dialogue_text: "Is that so? Then, you wander the Huginn Grove and I'll return to my duties."

D.response_text: "Of course, we wouldn't want the trees to run away now, would we?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0031!FOR.dialogue_text: "To the uninitiated, there are simply trees, stones and scrap metal, though you're still free to move about the grove and observe."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0032!FOR.dialogue_text: "Now if you'll excuse me, Brother, I intend to return to my tasks. Good day."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.004!FORM.dialogue_text: "Isn't it obvious? I should think it so to all of our Order..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0041!FOR.dialogue_text: "Medical advances deter death and disease. Meteorological advances help predict devastating weather. Technological advances provide weapons against the cruel universe that spawned us."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0042!FOR.dialogue_text: "Clearly any discovery we make would bring us closer to controlling our own destiny, Brother."

D.response_text: "Then we're of like mind..."

E.response_text: "The strong need only themselves to control destiny."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.005!FORM.dialogue_text: "Your argument is ludicrous and undermined by the very fact that you're a part of our Order. I would expect a more thoughtful thesis from you, Brother."

A.response_text: "Ha! Sorry, Sister; I was just stirring up trouble."

D.response_text: "Perhaps you simply didn't understand the argument?"

E.response_text: "Expectations are the mother of disappointment, Form Forger."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.006!FORM.dialogue_text: "I would prefer you didn't, Brother. Besides, all current iterations of rebuilt artifacts and Techne are non-functional or highly experimental... and reliably unstable."

F.response_text: "So... basically, if I touch stuff, it'll blow up?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.011!FORM.dialogue_text: "With all due respect, Brother Inquisitor, if you're interested in idle chat, I'm ill-suited to the task - a shortage of patience and affability, you see. So if it's all the same to you, I'd like to return to my duties."

A.response_text: "Yes of course. Sorry to disturb you, Sister."

E.response_text: "You're ill-suited to more than just chatting..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.012!FORM.dialogue_text: "Despite continued efforts, we cannot solve the mystery of the cloudstone from the Seat of the True Archon - a tangled knot too complex to untie, yet too sturdy to cut through."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0121!FOR.dialogue_text: "No amount of experimentation has yielded any useful results."

A.response_text: "Even the Architects can't figure it out? Must be tough!"

B.response_text: "What about the cloudstone makes it so inscrutable?"

C.response_text: "Maybe there's no need to untie it."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.013!FORM.dialogue_text: "With all due respect, Brother Inquisitor, if you're interested in idle chat, I'm ill-suited to the task - a shortage of patience and affability, you see. So if it's all the same to you, I'd like to return to my duties."

D.response_text: "And here I thought I was being charming..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.014!FORM.dialogue_text: "With all due respect, Brother Inquisitor, if you're interested in idle chat, I'm ill-suited to the task - a shortage of patience and social grace, you see. So if it's all the same to you, I'd like to return to my duties."

D.response_text: "Idle indeed... And here I thought I was being charming..."

E.response_text: "Yes, you must be busy 'curating' all the failures..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0140!FOR.dialogue_text: "Unlikely, but prove my hypothesis false, Brother."

D.response_text: "Your premise that I joined the Order to get help is false."

E.response_text: "I help the Order; it's not mutual."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.015!FORM.dialogue_text: "With all due respect, Brother Inquisitor, if you're interested in idle chat, I'm ill-suited to the task - a shortage of patience and wit, you see. So if it's all the same to you, I'd like to return to my duties."

A.response_text: "An honest appraisal. I'll seek prey less meek."

D.response_text: "Subservience suits you, Sister."

E.response_text: "Then you're dismissed."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0150!FOR.dialogue_text: "All is as it should be. I take my leave, Brother."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0151!FOR.dialogue_text: "If that is all, then I shall take my leave, Brother."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.016!FORM.dialogue_text: "Perhaps, but more likely it would irrevocably alter the fabric of your Trueflesh into some accursed abomination..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0160!FOR.dialogue_text: "Yet, I recognize that there is little I can do to stop a determined mage, at the very least you have been warned."

F.response_text: "Warned? More like encouraged!"
"TALLY HO!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.024!FORM.dialogue_text: "If you didn't join for the vast resources and support of fellow magi, then what motive compelled you to enter the Order of the Enclave?"

D.response_text: "My reasons are my own."

E.response_text: "To kill time."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0243!FOR.dialogue_text: "A weak reason, but a reason counter to my hypothesis, indeed."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0245!FOR.dialogue_text: "A weak reason, but a reason counter to my hypothesis, indeed."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.025!FORM.dialogue_text: "With all due respect, Brother Inquisitor, if you are interested in baseless braggadocio, I am of insufficient patience and desire to lend you an ear. So if it's all the same to you, I would like to return to my duties."

D.response_text: "Baseless? Hardly! I am almost guaranteed to ascend to Archon!"

E.response_text: "You will leave when I tell you to!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.031!FORM.dialogue_text: "Indeed. Now if you will excuse me, I intend to return to my duties. Good day, Brother."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.032!FORM.dialogue_text: "For one, its patterns match no known instances of cloudstone Techne symbols according to our semiotic analysis. Some have even proposed that it's not even a cloudstone, though most reject this hypothesis, given its dimensions and material construction."

A.response_text: "Well, you certainly have your work cut out for you then!"

B.response_text: "Both shields and cogwheels can be made of metal or wood..."

C.response_text: "Not all puzzles need to be solved, I suppose."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.03200!FO.dialogue_text: "Yes, I see your point, Brother. Perhaps we can re-evaluate this discarded hypothesis."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.03201!FO.dialogue_text: "Though, if I recall, it was the Choir of Archons themselves who saw no water in that well and encouraged us to cast it aside."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.03202!FO.dialogue_text: "If their wisdom sees no value in it, then we would likely just be chasing castles in the sky."

A.response_text: "Well, if the Choir says it's not worth pursuing, then best not to."

B.response_text: "Though wise, even the Choir is not infallible."

C.response_text: "Then, all is as it should be."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0321!FOR.dialogue_text: "Truth is with you, Brother Inquisitor... Yet, they are our light in the absence of Awareness. So until we have ascended, it is best to defer to their judgment."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.033!FORM.dialogue_text: "All unsolved puzzles are unbiased reminders of how little we know. Leave them unexamined, and we will remain only as wise as when we first achieved the Falseflesh."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!HUGINN GROVE!0.0330!FOR.dialogue_text: "Our very Order is predicated on unraveling the underlying mysteries of our universe. If you disagree, I feel there's little reason for you to have joined the Enclave."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.001!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text:
Through the arched corridor lies a chamber wide enough to escape vision's periphery and tall enough to break a neck. Several thousands of stories compose this cyclopean structure, rings spiraling around a void pillar. From above, light cascades in through a massive aperture to the midday sky. Myriad rooms are carved into the rocky skin of the mountain's interior as they impertinently climb heaven-bound, ever-reaching for the heights the Vanquished once soared.

		At the center stands a Muninn tree, perhaps larger than all other Muninns combined. Its knotted, pearlescent branches reach forth from a mighty trunk, yearning for and growing towards the white crystals dotting the rooms along the walls.

		Rippling forth from its base are concentric rows of tables filled with scores of scholarly magi, studying, researching, ever-chasing the shadows of ignorance from their minds with the torch of Discipline.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X0010!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Though most seem too enthralled by their work to offer discussion, a certain Sister appears to be casting furtive glances at Ormenos over the top of several stacked volumes. Many have joined the Order in the decade, making remembering names more challenging than reviving the Vanquished from their graves. However, she looks familiar, very familiar.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X00101!DESCR.dialogue_text: Ormenos approaches, searching his memory for her name; though it seems  he would have more luck casting nets to catch the wind. He nears as she shuts her book, a finger marking the page...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00102!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Sister Midnight silently nods and promptly forgets Ormenos even exists. Cracking open her book, she begins to pore over her texts as though she had never been interrupted.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00103!DESCRI.dialogue_text: It seems now there truly are none with whom to speak. An appearance from the Sylvan Architect himself would scarcely raise a few noses from the books they find themselves so deeply buried in - though, Ormenos never expected to find idle conversation here in the Mathetia anyway.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0011!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Ormenos wanders, observing the studious magi hither, thither and yon. But as usual, he finds himself gravitating towards the colossal Muninn. Sight tracing trunk to branches, he sees the tree's myriad limbs explode outwards, latching onto the spiraling floors several hundred paces away. They wind themselves tightly around the spiral railing, warping iron bars, replacing whole swaths of dark metal with brilliant, gnarled wood. Up and up they go, weaving their way through stories upon stories of intricately carved architectural embellishments.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00110!DESCRI.dialogue_text: This great wooden spine of the Mathetia is ancient beyond measure, predating the Order itself. The thought sparks another; Ormenos recalls a theory he once heard that it may have been the original Muninn. It appears that many magi came to believe it simply on the strength of this being the only living Muninn of with no connection to a Thought Wheel. Centuries later, news came from Kabu that a method to cultivate Muninns independent of Thought Wheels did in fact exist. The theory fell into the mire of failed thoughts, its author's name along with it.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00111!DESCRI.dialogue_text: His mind and feet continue to meander, slowly spiraling in towards the great white trunk and its forgotten past. Soon he finds himself circling the Muninn, caught in its invisible vortex. Closer, closer, ever closer he falls, in towards the giant's center. Round and round he goes, soon brushing up against the dark iron railing surrounding the tree. The body's fear instinctively draws eyes to the bottomless chasm the other side of the railing, that mysterious pit housing the Muninn's roots. All attempts to plumb its depths are always just rewarded with death and confusion. A stone dropped into the darkness will make no sound upon hitting the bottom - if it ever does. Even the Muninn's ghostly light eventually succumbs to the abyss' appetite...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X00112!DESCR.dialogue_text: Ormenos' vision focuses. Sight returns, though he never knew it had left him. His feet have stopped. For how long, he cannot say. All he knows is that his path's invisible spiral has abruptly terminated at the edge of a crowd, one gathered round a Brother and Sister in heated debate.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00113!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The debate at its terminus, the crowd disbands and all return to their tasks. Even such small deviations from one's work can lead to dire consequences. All present well know the Choir of Archons are anything but miserly when doling out punishments for negligence of duty.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0012!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: There appear to be three points of egress from the Mathetia: the same portal whence Ormenos entered the Archives, and the two massive wings of the Archive - the Wing of Actuality with its Muninn Grove and Scriptorium; and the Wing of Potentiality with its Huginn Grove and the Seat of the True Archon.\n\n\t\tAs a Thought-Weaver, Ormenos regularly haunts the Vault down in the Third Sphere, but many moons ago when he had first arrived, he would spend countless hours in these Archives, devouring the knowledge his predecessors had left. Indeed, he cannot help but feel a small bout of nostalgia creep up on him as he decides where to direct his feet.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00120!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Before he can form the thought, he realizes he has already arrived at the cusp of the Wing of Actuality and the Mathetia, as though the decision had been made for him. He shakes his head, attempting to loosen the grip of such nonsensical fancies from his mind. Now he must think on where his ultimate destination lies.\n\n        His options number few: he could return to the foyer of the Mathetia, enter the Scriptorium, or pay a visit to the Muninn Grove.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X001200!DESC.dialogue_text: Feet gliding in the direction of the Scriptorium, Ormenos spies the familiar cautionary sign, forbidding magi from entering more than once per cycle. The portal to the chamber then opens, ready to devour the curious mage as he disappears through it.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X001201!DESC.dialogue_text: Feet gliding in the direction of the Scriptorium, Ormenos spies the familiar cautionary sign, forbidding magi from entering more than once per cycle. This is the second time he seeks to enter this cycle and it is hard to say what the consequences of such actions might be... Yet, the ambivalent portal to the chamber still opens, again ready to devour the curious mage.

F.response_text: Enter despite the dangers

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X001202!DESC.dialogue_text: Feet gliding in the direction of the Scriptorium, Ormenos spies the familiar cautionary sign, forbidding magi from entering more than once per cycle. This marks the third time he seeks to enter this cycle, and given the dying effect of the herbs, one can only assume Ormenos will overdose upon entering again. Too much of a good thing can be bad... Yet, the ambivalent portal to the chamber opens, ready to devour the curious mage once more.

D.response_text: Heed the warnings

F.response_text: Enter despite the dangers

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.001203!DESCR.dialogue_text: At even the thought of entering the Scriptorium, the mage's stomach churns; acid erupting into his throat burns as it slides back towards its origin. The mere idea of returning taxes his flesh to its breaking point. His feet freeze in place, the perfect likeness of a statue. Something impels him to go, yet something deeper prevents him from doing so.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.001204!DESCR.dialogue_text: Before long, the war between fleshes False and True wipes the mage aside, forgetting his very existence. A victor emerges and his feet carry him to a destination he is too exhausted to care about.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00121!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Ormenos suddenly realizes he now stands at the cusp of the Wing of Actuality and the Mathetia - before even deciding to do so. But he knows that makes no sense; he really must be working too hard. Clasping his hand over his temples, he gently rubs the tension away as best he can.\n\n        Not wanting to dwell on impossibilities, he begins to think on where his ultimate destination lies. Return to the foyer of the Mathetia? Enter the Seat of the True Archon? Or perhaps walk among the trees of the Huginn Grove?

A.response_text: Enter the Seat of the True Archon

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.002!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Ormenos now stands in the vast congregation hall of the Enclave Archives. He witnessed a debate here not too long ago, but it seems that the austere and studious magi will only allow themselves such excesses and deviations from work on the rarest of occasions.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.003!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: As Ormenos walks by, all seem to cast furtive half-glances at him. Whispers of thoughts reach his mindsight as he hears people chastising him for his vagrancy. Long ago was he to have reported to the Choir of Archons and he is pushing the boundaries of their collective patience. For the good of the Enclave, all must fall in line and the nail that rears its impetuous head will be summarily smashed into its proper place.

A.response_text: Go to the Nave to report to the Choir of Archons

E.response_text: The Choir can wait; my needs take precedence

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0030!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: And as a well-trained pup, Ormenos bends to the will of the Order. As though a Neverborn, his feet now automatically guide him toward his neglected duties, toward the Hall of Reckoning.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0031!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: And as a rowboat on a savage and tempestuous ocean, Ormenos stands in defiance to the establishment. For what could they possibly do to him?

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X004!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Ormenos drags heavy feet into the Mathetia, boots filled with the leaden weights of his doubts, fears and anxieties. The Inquisitor's troubled mind is met with the undeniable sign that his Falseflesh will soon be equally troubled. The appearance of Brother Beast Lord and a retinue of Enforcers marks an end to the Choir's patience...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0040!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: The Beast Lord then escorts Ormenos unto the Nave and into the clutches of the slighted Choir of Archons to accept his punishment.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.005!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: The Memory Keeper rushes through the halls undeterred by the multitude of magi... or is it GREMLINS?! Yes, undeterred by the repugnant halflings blocking his straight-lined path to victory! He laughs maniacally as he incinerates all obstacles! More a boisterous caw, than a laugh, to be fair.\n\n\t\tThe entire hall is in a panic when the killjoys arrive. These so-called 'Enforcers' have been, all this time, simply demons masquerading as allies. Well, are they in for a surprise! Because...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0050!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: A thud... Great pain... Sudden collapse... Descending darkness...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.000!BEAST LO.dialogue_text: "Brother Inquisitor, I've been dispatched to escort you to the Nave. Your truancy has not gone... unnoticed..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.001!BEAST LO.dialogue_text: "...May I speak candidly with you, Brother?"

B.response_text: "I'd prefer if everyone were always candid."

D.response_text: "Unless it's to tell me I'm free to go, then no."

E.response_text: "Let's just go to the Nave and get it over with."

F.response_text: "NOW caveman want talkie-talk! But in Kabu only give cold shoulder!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0020!BEAST L.dialogue_text: "...What happened to you, Brother? When did ice replace fire in your words?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00200!BEAST.dialogue_text: "...A useless inquiry, I suppose. After all, there's no way to ask the snow how it grew cold..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00201!BEAST.dialogue_text: "All is ever as it should be."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00202!BEAST.dialogue_text: "Brothers! Sisters! Members of the Enclave! Listen well!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00203!BEAST.dialogue_text: "Ormenos has been utterly negligent in his duties to us, his only family! Idling time away as though it grew on Muninns."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00204!BEAST.dialogue_text: "But time is precious, ever-diminishing; its wasteful misuse is a crime of the highest order!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00205!BEAST.dialogue_text: "And so the Choir has summoned him, to stand before them, to bear the weight of their righteous judgment!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00206!BEAST.dialogue_text: "Seek not his path! Break all ties of kinship! - lest you follow him to the Vault..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00210!BEAST.dialogue_text: "When I first came to the Order, you were already renowned and respected - perfection made flesh."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00211!BEAST.dialogue_text: "You'd already accomplished more in your five year tenure than most magi do in a lifetime."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00212!BEAST.dialogue_text: "And in the years since, I've witnessed you do everything the Choir demanded of you, always without complaint."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00213!BEAST.dialogue_text: "I won't belabor the point, but you're clearly anything but a negligent member of the Order."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00214!BEAST.dialogue_text: "So, why, Ormenos? Why have you forsaken your duties? Why throw it all away now?"

A.response_text: "Why does a delayed report matter so much to the Choir?"

B.response_text: "Because I have more important affairs to attend to."

E.response_text: "And why exactly must we respond to the crack of the Choir's whip?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0022!BEAST L.dialogue_text: "Candidness... Yes, I too wish everyone could just be candid."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00220!BEAST.dialogue_text: "But it looks like we'll just have to settle for it between us two for now."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00221!BEAST.dialogue_text: "What I wanted to say was that when I first came to the Order, you were already renowned and respected - perfection made flesh."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00222!BEAST.dialogue_text: "You'd already accomplished more in your five year tenure than most magi do in a lifetime."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00223!BEAST.dialogue_text: "And in the years since, I've witnessed you do everything the Choir demanded of you, always without complaint."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00224!BEAST.dialogue_text: "I won't belabor the point, but you're clearly anything but a negligent member of the Order."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00225!BEAST.dialogue_text: "So, why, Ormenos? Why have you forsaken your duties? Why throw it all away now?"

A.response_text: "Why does a delayed report matter so much to the Choir?"

B.response_text: "Because I have more important affairs to attend to."

C.response_text: "I don't chose my actions, Adarin; they're chosen for me."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0023!BEAST L.dialogue_text: "What I wish to say is that when I first came to the Order, you were already renowned and respected - perfection made flesh."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00230!BEAST.dialogue_text: "You'd already accomplished more in your five year tenure than most magi do in a lifetime."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00231!BEAST.dialogue_text: "And in the years since, I've witnessed you do everything the Choir demanded of you, always without complaint."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00232!BEAST.dialogue_text: "I won't belabor the point, but you're clearly anything but a negligent member of the Order."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00233!BEAST.dialogue_text: "So, why, Ormenos? Why have you forsaken your duties? Why throw it all away now?"

B.response_text: "Because I have more important affairs to attend to."

C.response_text: "I don't chose my actions, Adarin; they're chosen for me."

D.response_text: "Why fuss over a simple delay?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0026!BEAST L.dialogue_text: "Caveman? Kabu? Brother, we first met after I came to the Enclave... And besides, you've never even been to my homeland..."

F.response_text: "How can I put this? You become a depressing, emo jerk in the future."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00260!BEAST.dialogue_text: "Regardless, it seems you've no intention of actually listening to a Brother's earnest words..."

F.response_text: "By Roostor's Comb! You misunderstand! You're destined to die alone in a cave!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0031!BEAST L.dialogue_text: "Ormenos, the Choir has never tolerated acts of insubordination! What possessed you to believe this policy had somehow changed?!"

A.response_text: "I just don't think the Choir's will should take precedence to all others."

B.response_text: "Curiosity guides my action, not the Choir's will."

E.response_text: "It'll never change when supposed 'beasts' allow themselves to be collared..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0032!BEAST L.dialogue_text: "What's of such supreme importance that you've staked your very life on it?!"

A.response_text: "I just don't think the Choir's will should take precedence to all others."

B.response_text: "Curiosity. It alone guides my action, not the Choir's will."

C.response_text: "Importance is a product of whim; nothing is 'supremely' important."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0033!BEAST L.dialogue_text: "I see my earnest concern is of little consequence to you."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0034!BEAST L.dialogue_text: "Ormenos, the Choir has never tolerated any acts of insubordination! What possessed you to believe this policy had somehow changed?!"

D.response_text: "It wasn't my choice! I was forced! Perhaps something to do with the Wayfarer!"

E.response_text: "It'll never change when supposed 'beasts' allow themselves to be collared..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0035!BEAST L.dialogue_text: "Ormenos, the Choir has never tolerated any acts of insubordination! What possessed you to believe this policy had somehow changed?!"

A.response_text: "And why should the Choir's will take precedence to all others?"

D.response_text: "It wasn't my choice! I was forced! Perhaps something to do with the Wayfarer!"

E.response_text: "It'll never change when supposed 'beasts' allow themselves to be tamed..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0041!BEAST L.dialogue_text: "I've little tolerance for your disloyal musings, Brother..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00410!BEAST.dialogue_text: "The Choir's will IS our will! Ever has been and ever will be, too!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00411!BEAST.dialogue_text: "We crush our own desires for the good of the Order!"

B.response_text: "Letting others think for you is nothing but willful ignorance..."

E.response_text: "I reject the bonds of our enslavers!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00412!BEAST.dialogue_text: "But we can reforge it in the fire of the mind, reshape it into its perfect form, into unity!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00413!BEAST.dialogue_text: "Though my argument clearly falls on deaf ears."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00414!BEAST.dialogue_text: "Farewell, Brother. May the decay of your Falseflesh precede the decay of your sanity..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0042!BEAST L.dialogue_text: "Then it's to the endless Void of the Graylands 'Curiosity' leads you, proud Inquisitor."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00420!BEAST.dialogue_text: "It pains me to have seen your fall... Once a proud and loyal Brother, now to be nothing more than a forgotten memory."

A.response_text: "Your pain is meaningless without change, Brother."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00421!BEAST.dialogue_text: "Perhaps it's for the best, for regret would profit you nothing at this point."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00422!BEAST.dialogue_text: "From the cultivator we seek knowledge of crops; from the artisans we seek skill of crafts; likewise from the Choir we seek wisdom beyond individual biases."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00440!BEAST.dialogue_text: "It pains me to have seen your fall... Once a proud and loyal Brother, now to be nothing more than a forgotten memory."

D.response_text: "Surely you could just say that I had 'escaped', Brother..."

E.response_text: "I reject the bonds of our enslavers!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00441!BEAST.dialogue_text: "And now you grovel for your worthless Falseflesh?! Does betrayal of the Order demand reward, Ormenos!?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0045!BEAST L.dialogue_text: "Certainly! We're just like tamed beasts! For aren't lowly beasts commanded to greater works by their betters?"

A.response_text: "Letting others think for you is nothing but willful ignorance..."

D.response_text: "Look, perhaps you could let your old friend 'accidentally' escape..."

E.response_text: "I reject the bonds of our enslavers!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00450!BEAST.dialogue_text: "Then you've gone the way of the Jinn Slayer..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00451!BEAST.dialogue_text: "You'll make fine bed fellows in the Vault."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X000!FORM FO.dialogue_text: "Illogical. Advancement of the Technocrafts far exceeds in importance the minutiae of running the Muninn Grove."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.001!FORM FOR.dialogue_text: "Records are important. However, without the new memories we generate from further experiments, you would have nothing more to store in your grove."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0010!FORM FO.dialogue_text: "Your function has meaning, but it is clearly secondary in importance to our work in the Huginn Grove, Brother."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X0011!FORM F.dialogue_text: "Is this not evident to you? I would think one as learned as you would know this simple truth."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X002!FORM FO.dialogue_text: "Brother Memory Keeper, the senior Thought-Weaver Brother Inquisitor is among us. Perhaps he can explain to you the hierarchy of our importances in a way that is more palatable and comprehensible."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X003!FORM FO.dialogue_text: "Said senseless artifacts could return to us the powers of the Vanquished, Brother. Imagine being able to Nearcast or even Farcast once more. Or to regain the ability to write new Techne. Or..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.004!FORM FOR.dialogue_text: "Brother Memory Keeper, we could both list numerous justifications. Why not be silent and let Brother Inquisitor speak his mind, first?"

A.response_text: "Is it not the case that you are mutually dependent?"

B.response_text: "The mistakes of the past will only be repeated when unremembered."

C.response_text: "Why does it matter whose job is more important?"

D.response_text: "Could it be that neither of you are as important as you imagine..?"

E.response_text: "Clearly using the memories ultimately gives them purpose."

F.response_text: "Ridiculous! I can't waste time here when the Mushroom Duke needs my help!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0041!FORM FO.dialogue_text: "Perhaps the organs of our body support each other, but one would find it difficult to defend the thesis that the person is subordinate to the organs."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00410!FORM F.dialogue_text: "Is it not sound logic to then say that although memories contribute to the advancement of the Technocrafts - that is to say, they are merely one of our many organs - is it not then fair to conclude that they are subordinate in nature to the noble deed that is advancement?"

A.response_text: "What makes 'advancement', a priori, a noble deed?"

B.response_text: "A person dies when organs fail. Thus, organs are more important."

E.response_text: "Indeed, our organs are meaningless without a person to sustain."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00411!FORM F.dialogue_text: "...I suppose I cannot say for sure it is. But, I should hope our pursuits have meaning... or is this but another baseless hope?"

B.response_text: "Perhaps one day we will know, but for now we cannot."

E.response_text: "Just quit bickering about who's superior and do your jobs!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0044!FORM FO.dialogue_text: "Yes, Brother, we all know of the fable of the 'frog in the well'. The implication is well-received."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00440!FORM F.dialogue_text: "Thank you for your guidance. We will endeavor to be as diligent in our duties as you are in yours."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X0045!FORM F.dialogue_text: "See, Brother Memory Keeper, it is only by virtue of our experiments with potentiality that the memories of your actuality have meaning."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00450!FORM F.dialogue_text: "Brother Memory Keeper is, as usual, overly-attached to his hypothesis. Rather unbecoming of one of our Order."

B.response_text: "I have other matters to attend to..."

D.response_text: "Should you need any other answers, you may come and find me."

E.response_text: "Just quit bickering about who's superior and do your jobs!"

F.response_text: "Yeah, it's happened to me, too... Left a nasty rash in an unsavory part of my anatomy."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0046!FORM FO.dialogue_text: "...Though I cannot quite... comprehend what it is you mean. I sense that your mockery is intended to imply we should not quibble over trivialities."

F.response_text: "Yeah, your petty bullshit means nothing compared to the loss of vegetable life!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00460!FORM F.dialogue_text: "Yes... of course, Brother. Thank you for your... guidance. We will leave you to your task of... vegetable rescue..."

F.response_text: "TALLY HO!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.00461!FORM F.dialogue_text: "Yes... of course, Brother. Thank you for your... guidance. We will leave you to your task of... improving your hygiene..."

F.response_text: "TALLY HO!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X000!MEMORY.dialogue_text: "Oh? And without the memories of the past, how do you expect to advance anything at all, Sister?!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X001!MEMORY.dialogue_text: "It is not evident, because it is nothing but a mendacious warping of actuality!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.002!MEMORY K.dialogue_text: "There it is again! Your presumption that your truth-blind opinion is fact!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0020!MEMORY.dialogue_text: "Brother Inquisitor, as a Thought-Weaver, I'm sure you have availed yourself of our Archives in the Muninn Grove on more occasions than most magi."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X0021!MEMORY.dialogue_text: "Would you tell this draug-brained ninny that the preservation of our priceless records is a greater priority than wasteful experimentation on senseless artifacts, please?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X003!MEMORY.dialogue_text: "Or imagine finding all the memories of the Vanquished who already knew how to accomplish these miracles among the Archives of the Muninn Grove and then simply learning from them!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X004!MEMORY.dialogue_text: "Aha! Not so high and mighty now, are we Sister Form Forger?!"

B.response_text: "I have other matters to attend to..."

D.response_text: "Should you need any other answers, you may come and find me."

E.response_text: "Just quit bickering about who's superior and do your jobs!"

F.response_text: "This dispute resolution had better pay off down the line..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0050!MEMORY.dialogue_text: "How... but, how... could you say that?!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0051!MEMORY.dialogue_text: "Birak's balls!! You mistake the Mathetia for the lavatory! Here we are supposed to produce 'theses'!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0052!MEMORY.dialogue_text: "But I won't wait for you to flush! Good day, my truth-blind siblings!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.X000!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Yes, Brother Inquisitar? I may assist ya, no?"

A.response_text: "Not with anything in particular. Can I help you, though?"

C.response_text: "I just came over because you were looking my way."

D.response_text: "How goes your research, Sister?"

E.response_text: "Stop staring at me, woman."

F.response_text: "Why do we all have weird nicknames?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.001!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "...Well, there's somethin' I'd like to ask, if ya've a moment..."

B.response_text: "I'll answer to the best of my abilities."

E.response_text: "Just make it quick."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.002!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "About the Cults Morticarum! Threads most uncanny tie together cults distant in both time and space!"

B.response_text: "What of these threads? How are the cults similar?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.003!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "Yes, truth's with ya... It's because ya're clankin of Brother Mind Seer; both of Jer, no?"

B.response_text: "It's indeed as you say, but what interest does my townsman hold for you?"

D.response_text: "And what did Brother Mind Seer do, Sister..?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.004!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "Mare progress made than I could've ever hoped far back with my clankin!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0040!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Oh, Archives're vast and the Muninns wise! Filled to burstin' with tomes on the Cults Morticarum! Ya'd not believe the threads most uncanny tyin' together cults distant in both time and space!"

D.response_text: "Cults Morticarum? They sound... dangerous..."

E.response_text: "Perhaps you should consider joining one..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.005!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "...Meant no ill will, Brother, and'll take care with the direction of my gaze future sightin's!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.006!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "...Ya crossed the Mathetia to ask me this?"

F.response_text: "Would you prefer I ask about the gremlin conspiracy instead?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.011!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "Thank ya, Brother! Brevity in wards from me, ar the Darkun take my tongue!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0110!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "I'd ask mare on Brother Mind Seer, far as I hear, ya're the only two magi of Jer in the Arder."

A.response_text: "Sure, what do you want to know?"

B.response_text: "It's as you say, but what interest does my townsman hold for you?"

E.response_text: "Just ask him directly!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0111!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Well... He's been requestin' many a tome regardin' the Cults Morticarum of Jer..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0112!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "To a worryin' extent, truth come to light."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0113!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Obsessed, that one, and I'd be hankerin' to know if he'd been... personally affected - hence motivatin' his investigative furar..?"

A.response_text: "But there've been no Dark Whispers in Jer for generations..."

B.response_text: "His family has a history of... 'madness'. It's why he left in the first place."

E.response_text: "His past? I neither know, nor do I care."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0114!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Ah, well, usually unnoticed the signs remain, 'til the cult's in full bloom."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0115!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "By all reparts, never has there been an instance of discovery befare the legions of the sacrificed's blood flooded the streets..."

A.response_text: "His family has never been accused of consorting with the Darkness."

B.response_text: "His family has a history of... 'madness'. It's why he left."

E.response_text: "Look, if you have any further questions, just ask him about it."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0117!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "But, I tell ya, Brother, be attentive of the Mind Seer. Far now, he stays on the right side of sanity, but the cults' depravity'd drive the curious far beyond the limits..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0119!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Should be gettin' back to the Muninn Grove, lest I join the Vault-dwellers far neglectin' my duties."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.012!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "Thank ya, Brother! Brevity in wards from me, ar the Darkun take my tongue!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0120!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "I'd ask more on Brother Mind Seer, far as I hear, ya're the only two magi of Jer in the Arder."

A.response_text: "Sure, what do you wish to know about him?"

B.response_text: "It is as you say, but what interest does my townsman hold for you?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0121!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Well... He's been requestin' many a tome regardin' the Cults Morticarum of Jer..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0122!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "To a worryin' extent, truth come to light."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0123!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Actions on the edge of obsession, if ya ask me, and I'd be hankerin' to know if he'd been... personally affected - hence motivatin' his investigative furar..?"

A.response_text: "There've been no Dark Whispers in Jer for generations..."

B.response_text: "His family has a history of... 'madness'. It's why he left."

C.response_text: "I think you should just ask him."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0125!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Histarically speakin', see, only Jer, Zemes and Neflim've fallen under charnel shadows, and in these cursed places madness is the mark of sanity - only the mad see what's invisible to the sane."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.013!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "Well... been requestin' many a tome regardin' the Cults Morticarum of Jer, that one has..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0131!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Actions on the edge of obsession, if ya ask me, and I'd be hankerin' to know if he'd been... personally affected - hence motivatin' his investigative furar..?"

B.response_text: "His family has a history of... 'madness'. It's why he left."

C.response_text: "I think you should just ask him."

D.response_text: "Cults Morticarum? They sound... dangerous..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.014!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "Well... been requestin' many a tome regardin' the Cults Morticarum of Jer, that one has..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0141!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Actions on the edge of obsession, if ya ask me, and I'd be hankerin' to know if he'd been... personally affected - hence motivatin' his investigative furar..?"

C.response_text: "I think you should just ask him."

D.response_text: "Cults Morticarum? They sound... dangerous..."

E.response_text: "His past? I neither know, nor do I care."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.015!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "...I can ask some other time. I'd not wish to hold ya up, no? Busy as ya must be."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0150!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Ya're to repart yar findin's to the Choir today, no?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0151!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "All us Archivists of the Muninn Grove've had to sate ourselves with whispers of the wildest speculation ever since we heard you discovered the care mem'ries of the Wayfarer!"

A.response_text: "I should go report, but you can ask your question first."

D.response_text: "Yes, I'm terribly busy; I'd best be on my way!"

E.response_text: "If you're not going to ask, them I'm leaving."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0152!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Yes... carse, Brother. I'll be leavin'. Sorry to have brought darkness to ya."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.016!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "I suppose... I'd prefer ya didn't. Well, suffice to say I've no good answer far either inquiry."

F.response_text: "Drat! Would you mind making a reason up then?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.021!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "Indeed, but the marose shouldn' be avoided 'cause of its abhorrence. Truth come to light, we can learn it to disempower its sway over us!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0210!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "By knowin' the underlyin' connections between the cults, we can be the ones to dissolve them!"

E.response_text: "I've better things to do."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0213!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "But... I've indeed found there's a price for Awareness, paid in loss of sanity."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0214!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "An hour a day at the Path helps temper any negative effects, no? But others busier might fare warse than a... a Suyuti's goat... wait, that's Kaban... far Jer it'd be... than a virgin with the Wyrm, no?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0215!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "In any event, Brother Inquisitar, I'd been wonderin', you mind a question, would you?"

E.response_text: "Just make it quick."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.022!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "There're far too many sim'larities to offer an exhaustive list, mind."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0220!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "But suffice to say, ya'd have black masses held at midnight in warship of the Abyssal Mother, ar bein' chased by nameless, unseen evils in Mindscape fugues drivin' men to madness, ar better yet, three and only three locations ever even havin' recards of these happenin's..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0221!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "And, carse, all cases leadin' to mass suicides!"

A.response_text: "Hmm, knowledge is power; studying them might help stop the cults."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0222!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Now this's mere speculation, mind, but I 'spect there's a connection with the Darkun of the Thiuda."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0223!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "I mean, all the cults do warship a dark, feminine idol, and who else'd that be? Yet, she must've died 'round the fall of the Thiuda."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0224!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "So, real question is, who took up where she left off?"

A.response_text: "Hmm, knowledge is power; studying them might help stop the cults."

B.response_text: "Could she not yet live? Immortality was trivial for the Vanquished."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0225!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Truth be on ya, but their secrets died with 'em. Even the Thiuda were nothin' but a newbarn foal in comparison..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0226!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "There's another possibility, somethin' likely fam'liar to ya, Brother Inquisitar..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0228!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "She's revered amon' the mystics of yar homeland, likely associates of the Cults Morticarum in Jer."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0229!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Couldn' they be selectin' female leaders to play off 'primitive' beliefs as uneducated?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.023!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "Birak's beard! 'Pologize, Brother; I'm easily excited at the thought of discoverin' who's castin' shadows on truth's face! Jus' know there's gotta be some trick to it."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0230!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Still, shouldn' be dronin' on more than a broken cloudstone..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0231!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "But, actually, if ya've a moment, Brother Inquisitar, I've been wonderin' about another topic..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0232!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "About Brother Mind Seer, if it pleases ya."

C.response_text: "I think you should just ask him."

D.response_text: "Why's it you wish to speak of Brother Mind Seer, Sister..?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0240!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Histarically, they've decimated pop'lations and when collective mem'ry of the last'un fades to farget, decadence darkens the light of Awareness anew, and the cults reappear far 'ritual' cleansin'!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0241!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Insanity, it is, that even after cent'ries of existence, they're only known to those who seek 'em out - like yar humble Sister, here..."

C.response_text: "That's great, but I think I should be going..."

D.response_text: "Is there no way to stop them?!"

E.response_text: "Sometimes I think about performing a 'cleansing' of my own."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0242!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Well, all I can say's the cults've been panthers in shadows far countless generations, and're only indirectly known by their murderous effects..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0243!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "To stop 'em, ya'd need to nip the source, but how ya gonna prune rose bushes in the dark?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0244!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Now this's mere speculation, mind, but I 'spect there's a connection with the Darkun of the Thiuda."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0245!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "I mean, all the cults warship a dark, feminine idol, who else could that be? Yet, she must've died 'round the fall of the Thiuda."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0246!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "So, real question is, who took up where she left off?"

D.response_text: "I think I've heard enough of this..."

E.response_text: "Who even cares? All idiots that die deserve it."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0250!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "I'm imaginin' the stress from the Mind-Loom wears on yar psyche; sure hope the Choir gives ya some rest after the Wayfarer..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0251!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "'Haps I'd best leave ya to yar duties, Brother."

D.response_text: "Not yet! What more do you have to say?!"

E.response_text: "Yes, unless you wanna find out where the cults takes their victims..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.026!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "I'm a Sister of the Arder of the Enclave! I don' 'make up' facts; I uncover 'em!"

F.response_text: "Oh, okay..."
"...so is that a no? It sounds like a definite maybe, but..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0261!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Brother, I advise ya to go far a relaxation session in the Scriptarium - provided ya haven't already made the visit this cycle."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0262!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "I feel... the stress of the Wayfarer assignment has taken its toll."

F.response_text: "Well... Uh... Damn! I wish you had my name!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0263!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Dare I ask why ya'd want that?"

F.response_text: "So I could tell you to change it to 'Bore-menos'! Ha!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0264!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Indeed, Brother. Hurry on over to the Scriptarium, lest the Darkun take yar sanity..."

F.response_text: "Worry not! My mind is already far past the point of no return!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.034!MIDNIGHT.dialogue_text: "...Well, there's somethin' I'd like to ask, if ya've a moment..."

D.response_text: "Fool! I don't want to answer your questions! Tell me of the Cults Morticarum!"

E.response_text: "Just make it quick."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0340!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "...Of carse, Brother... Well, there're far too many sim'larities to offer an exhaustive list."

D.response_text: "Go on!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0341!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "But suffice to say it'd include black masses held at midnight in warship of the Mother of the Abyss, ar Mindscape fugues of bein' chased by evils both nameless and unseen, drivin' men to madness, ar even three and only three locations ever having records of such happenin's..."

D.response_text: "What else?!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0342!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "These're but a few of the comm'nalities tyin' the cults together..."

D.response_text: "And?!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MATHETIA!0.0343!MIDNIGH.dialogue_text: "Brother... 'fraid, I've nothin' mare to add... other than ya're frightenin' me."

D.response_text: "Bah! If you've got no more to say, then out of my sight!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00100!DE.dialogue_text: The dank stench of stale air in the Archive corridors fades to forget as Ormenos steps into the shadowless Muninn Grove. Lights from myriad crystal arrays cast the surroundings in a perpetual daylight, crisply illuminating all objects from all angles.\tThe massive chamber gradually slopes downward, deep into the mountain's bowels, trees filling every last nook and cranny all the way to the area's invisible limits. Muninn limbs stretch across the ceiling and all along the walls, ever-searching for space to accommodate their expanding contents.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00101!DE.dialogue_text: Many junior Archivists hustle about, busy at work, often tending to saplings or arranging crystalline arrays to direct their growth. The more senior Archivists likewise sweat over their labors, sharing memories to slake the larger Muninns' thirsts for information. Recorded thought abounds within the network of Muninns, enough to make the stars seem countable. Not even centuries of Archivist delving has revealed more than a pitiful fraction of the memories predating the Order. The impossibility of the task winds a bitter smirk into Ormenos' face, lifting lip edges ever so slightly skyward. These curls begin to spiral in on themselves as his mind wanders to the Thought Wheel of the Beginning. Its contents will make this grove seem a hair to a mane; even if everyone everywhere became an Archivist, an eternity would still leave some thoughts undiscovered in its depths.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00102!DE.dialogue_text: Ormenos muses on his musings, remembering the tale the Sumarkandian witch from the reports on the Wayfarer. Something about a man condemned to roll a boulder up a mountain path, only to always have it roll back down. In the witch's story it was designed to warn of obsession with hopeless tasks, though Ormenos always found an ineffable nobility in the project - then again, perhaps Sister Gate Keeper was right, that madness was simply beginning to sequester his wits; he dared not dwell too long on the possibility.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X00103!D.dialogue_text: Motion drew his ghost back to the physical space before him and he began to search for whatever it is he came here to do - if he could only remember why he came in the first place. His eyes land on the Curator, most senior among the Archivists, a stone's throw from his current locus.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00104!DE.dialogue_text: Motion draws his attention back to reality, and he begins to search for what brought him here - now, if only he could remember why he came in the first place. His eyes land on the Curator, most senior among the Archivists, a stone's throw from his current locus. A second thought comes in near simultaneity, that perhaps the recent debate took all the talk out of the excitable Curator - though in Ormenos' experience, Brother Memory Keeper's average conversation might fill a Muninn or two.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X0010!DE.dialogue_text: Ormenos approaches the Curator to speak. The Curator lazily scrutinizes of some documents chaotically strewn about his desk, trying his best to ignore the visitor. Curiosity and pride battle ferociously across his face. Eyes twitch and brows furrow; snarls roll in waves across his upper lip; and briefly his hands join the fight, seemingly trying to compress his cheeks into a single point. Yet almost as soon as it had started, the war ends, curiosity the victor - a safe bet with any Enclavean.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X0011!DE.dialogue_text: The conversation at an end, the Memory Keeper resumes his active ignoring, randomly rearranging piles of documents while inaudibly conversing with himself - though this is an exclusive conversation, it seems.
