ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00110!DE.dialogue_text: Giddy as an aroused jackrabbit, the Memory Keeper quickens his pace to the door, beckoning Ormenos, demanding he make haste so that they can begin their new life together. Such a sense of urgency, such an unmitigated and singular focus wells up within the Curator that Orm... er... Stalphos, now sees a brilliant, golden, avian aura surrounding the man. Roostor hath descended upon one of His chosen to guide him toward the complete and utter annihilation of the devilish fiends that would seek to sully His turf.\n\n\t\tAnd with this thought, Stalphos gives chase, attempting to catch up with his new partner in gremlin-slaying!

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00120!DE.dialogue_text: A thought, a command, a necessity. Like the sun emerging from behind a storm cloud, it was always there, simply hidden from view. Before he gives the word, his feet already carry him deeper into the grove. He does this despite knowing he is incapable of communing with the trees, lacking the Techne and the powerful artifacts of the Archivists. Thus, he must content himself with the warm glow of the Order's collective knowledge growing before him.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00121!DE.dialogue_text: A thought, a command, a necessity. Like the sun emerging from behind a storm cloud, it was always there, simply hidden from view. Before he gives the word, his feet already carry him deeper into the grove.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00122!DE.dialogue_text: White, crystal light bathes him, uncountable rays overlapping into unbroken beams, the beams adding into an indivisible whole. The shadows of ignorance find no foothold in this place, burned away by the infinite memories of the Muninn, for even the future is said to lurk deep within the trees. Ormenos long yearned to find the fabled Interstice of the Thiuda, to walk with Wulfias and learn the forbidden truths as he did. To escape the injuries of uncertainty...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X00123!D.dialogue_text: But alas, those paths died with the Wolf of Thiuda.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00124!DE.dialogue_text: Suddenly, a ray seems to unweave itself from the seamless tapestry of light and a foreign awareness wells up within Ormenos. Soon a ravenous beast seems to growl from within the Inquisitor, compelling him to touch the trees and absorb their knowledge. Odd, for a Thought-Weaver to acquire this ability at all, let alone unassisted, is unfathomable... Yet still, this desire to commune with the tree is very real, his quivering hands the proof.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X00125!D.dialogue_text: And once more the Inquisitor finds himself lusting after the energetic nectar of the Muninn trees; sweet memories' taste chills the mind, while deep knowledge's spice warms the soul.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X00126!D.dialogue_text: And once more the Inquisitor finds himself lusting after the energetic nectar of the Muninn trees; sweet memories' taste chills the mind, while deep knowledge's spice warms the soul.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X00127!D.dialogue_text: And once more the Inquisitor finds himself lusting after the energetic nectar of the Muninn trees; sweet memories' taste chills the mind, while deep knowledge's spice warms the soul.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X00128!D.dialogue_text: And once more the Inquisitor finds himself lusting after the energetic nectar of the Muninn trees; sweet memories' taste chills the mind, while deep knowledge's spice warms the soul.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X00129!D.dialogue_text: Though far from exhausting the innumerable resources of this grove, Ormenos now finds nothing of further interest.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X00130!D.dialogue_text: And once more the Inquisitor finds himself lusting after the energetic nectar of the Muninn trees; sweet memories' taste chills the mind, while deep knowledge's spice warms the soul.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X00131!D.dialogue_text: And once more the Inquisitor finds himself lusting after the energetic nectar of the Muninn trees; sweet memories' taste chills the mind, while deep knowledge's spice warms the soul.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X00132!D.dialogue_text: And once more the Inquisitor finds himself lusting after the energetic nectar of the Muninn trees; sweet memories' taste chills the mind, while deep knowledge's spice warms the soul.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X00133!D.dialogue_text: And once more the Inquisitor finds himself lusting after the energetic nectar of the Muninn trees; sweet memories' taste chills the mind, while deep knowledge's spice warms the soul.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X00134!D.dialogue_text: And once more the Inquisitor finds himself lusting after the energetic nectar of the Muninn trees; sweet memories' taste chills the mind, while deep knowledge's spice warms the soul.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X00135!D.dialogue_text: And once more the Inquisitor finds himself lusting after the energetic nectar of the Muninn trees; sweet memories' taste chills the mind, while deep knowledge's spice warms the soul.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X00136!D.dialogue_text: And once more the Inquisitor finds himself lusting after the energetic nectar of the Muninn trees; sweet memories' taste chills the mind, while deep knowledge's spice warms the soul.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X00137!D.dialogue_text: And once more the Inquisitor finds himself lusting after the energetic nectar of the Muninn trees; sweet memories' taste chills the mind, while deep knowledge's spice warms the soul.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00138!DE.dialogue_text: Though abundant beyond measure are the Muninn's memories, even it does not know infinity. But now, Ormenos feels the crushing weight of the boundless on his Trueflesh. In an instant, all knowledge - past, future, and present - flows through him.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.001380!D.dialogue_text: All his lives... no, all lives... He has lived it all, done it all, been everything and everyone. Now he looks upon the collective memories of the Self but cannot see; he listens but cannot hear. The chaos of totality's sum destroys his psyche, causing legs to tremble and heart to pound. He cowers, penitent, lustful now for ignorance's bliss.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.001381!D.dialogue_text: He is broken. Unwilling. He can learn no more. He will learn no more.

D.response_text: EIDOS

E.response_text: WULFIAS

F.response_text: EIDOS

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00139!DE.dialogue_text: Shock descends like a veil on Ormenos' face, weighing heavy on his downward curving lips. Assimilating the tome's contents was so... easy. So inconceivably easy. An ordinary mage feels nothing but heat from the Muninn crystals; an Archivist feels the seeds writhing beneath. Only after decades of careful study will an Archivist learn to see the connections between the seeds and recreate the latent memories within. Only then do then earn the title of Senior Archivist.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013900!.dialogue_text: Ormenos knows no mage shy of the Sylvan Architect could ever master two occult skills. As a Senior Thought-Weaver, he never even dreamed of being able to decipher the Muninn's secrets. It makes no sense to him; it is without precedent. But facts are facts, however unexplained they may be.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013901!.dialogue_text: And at the recognition of these facts, the Inquisitor's Dread swells, high tides of anxiety crashing on a fragile psyche. Ormenos floats above the image of his Falseflesh, chained to a rock mid-sea. He stares down, breathing shallowly, a breath per speeding heartbeat. He cannot acknowledge it as his own flesh or he will crumble and only despair will remain.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013902!.dialogue_text: He has been here many times before, besting Dread with an ever-increasing effort. But this time its weight seems to drag the rock and the surrounding waters skywards, up to floating mage.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013903!.dialogue_text: Higher, higher, till sea foam stains his robes.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013904!.dialogue_text: Higher, higher, ever-higher, till chains bind his wrists.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013905!.dialogue_text: The sea swells, wetting his knees, thighs soon to follow.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013906!.dialogue_text: He wants to scream and rage against the chains, but doing so will only increase their reality.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013907!.dialogue_text: And so he breathes, bringing his heart from a gallop to a canter. With each slow inhalation, rust creeps into the chains, waning slightly as he exhales.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013908!.dialogue_text: The water rising to his chest, brings sea salt's sting to wide eyes.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013909!.dialogue_text: Breathing, breathing. From canter to trot. The rust begins to crumble.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013910!.dialogue_text: The sea licks his chin, soon pouring in through his open mouth.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013911!.dialogue_text: Rusted chains shatter; bloodshot eyes close; perfect darkness reigns in the silent wake of the chains dying echo.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013912!.dialogue_text: The Muninn's white light floods in as Ormenos opens his eyes. He slumps against the tree, exhausted. These battles grow more numerous by the day, each one worse than the last.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013913!.dialogue_text: But here he is, victorious against all odds. He persists!

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013914!.dialogue_text: Yet, Dread has not left him without scars. Its cancerous fear yet lingers, slightly larger than before, promising to chip away at his resolve like some mad sculptor.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013915!.dialogue_text: When Chance's mercy fails, he will be at Dread's mercy. More a question of when than if.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0013916!.dialogue_text: Despite the inevitable tragedy that awaits, he knows that now, in this moment, he yet stands. And so, steadying trembling knees, he prepares to move on.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00140!DE.dialogue_text: Shock descends like a veil on Ormenos' face, weighing heavy on his downward curving lips. Assimilating the tome's contents was so... easy. So inconceivably easy. An ordinary mage feels nothing but heat from the Muninn crystals; an Archivist feels the seeds writhing beneath. Only after decades of careful study will an Archivist learn to see the connections between the seeds and recreate the latent memories within. Only then do then earn the title of Senior Archivist.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0014000!.dialogue_text: Ormenos knows no mage shy of the Sylvan Architect could ever master two occult skills. As a Senior Thought-Weaver, he never even dreamed of being able to decipher the Muninn's secrets. It makes no sense to him; it is without precedent. But facts are facts, however unexplained they may be.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0014001!.dialogue_text: And at the recognition of these facts, the Inquisitor's feels...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0014003!.dialogue_text: Long has his mind been a stranger to this feeling; so long, in fact, that he barely recognized it.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0014004!.dialogue_text: His usual companions are Fear and Dread, the friends that convinced him to leave Jer to seek the sanctuary of Discipline, the very friends that encouraged him to pursue Thought-Weaving. Friends of the most devout kind: so intimate, they never leave his side; so committed, their goal remains unaltered by the decades.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0014005!.dialogue_text: These are the friends Ormenos will slay at all costs.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0014006!.dialogue_text: From his dives into Kaban Brothers and even the Wayfarer, he has caught a glimpse of what could be...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0014007!.dialogue_text: He has learned of the Unseen.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0014008!.dialogue_text: But why think on this now, in this rare moment of peace?

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0014009!.dialogue_text: His thoughts always seem to ruin it all. Perhaps the inevitable tragedy that awaits is what he deserves.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0014010!.dialogue_text: All he knows is that he will find neither tragedy nor reprieve if he does not move on. And so he does.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00141!DE.dialogue_text: The restless mage ambles through the grove, in search of the exit. But he has strayed too far afield. It always seems to be the same, always wanting and chasing an impossible dream. The words of the Phrygian Wisemen creep to the forefront of memory.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00142!DE.dialogue_text:
"When sought never is it found,
        Ever by desire bound.
        Yet freed, in trust,
        From mind's own lust,
        Birds seized in flight,
        Drift gently down onto the ground."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00143!DE.dialogue_text: Birds appear so often in Phrygian aphorisms, and in so many different capacities - oft ranging from meals to abstract notions of Truth and Love. Ormenos feels an odd sympathy for the birds; trapped, slain, plucked, or cooked, they never seem to catch a break. This then reminds him it is the third night in the cycle and thus the smell of roast turkey will fill the Refectory later this evening. His sympathy is short-lived, thwarted by a lifetime of indirect bird slaughter.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.00144!DE.dialogue_text: But soon the rattling echoes of this chain of thought fade into memory, and no sooner does Ormenos arrive at his forgotten destination. Perhaps in letting desire subside, he finally found it; of perhaps it was simply chaotic randomness mistaken for an underlying order. Whatever the case may be, he is here now. He then boldly walks through the exit and out of the Muninn Grove.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.002!DESC.dialogue_text: The dank stench of stale air in the Archive corridors fades to forget as Ormenos steps into the shadowless Muninn Grove. Lights from myriad crystal arrays cast the surroundings in a perpetual daylight, crisply illuminating all objects from all angles.\tThe massive chamber gradually slopes downward, deep into the mountain's bowels, trees filling every last nook and cranny all the way to the area's invisible limits. Muninn limbs stretch across the ceiling and all along the walls, ever-searching for space to accommodate their expanding contents.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0020!DES.dialogue_text: Many junior Archivists bustle about, busy at work, often tending to saplings or arranging crystalline arrays to direct their growth. The more senior Archivists likewise sweat over their labors, sharing memories to slake the larger Muninns' thirsts for information. Recorded thought abounds within the network of Muninns, enough to make the stars seem countable. Not even centuries of Archivist delving has revealed more than a pitiful fraction of the memories predating the Order. The impossibility of the task winds a bitter smirk into Ormenos' face, lifting lip edges ever so slightly skyward. These curls begin to spiral in on themselves as his mind wanders to the Thought Wheel of the Beginning. Its contents will make this grove seem a hair to a mane; even if everyone everywhere became an Archivist, an eternity would still leave some thoughts undiscovered in its depths.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0021!DES.dialogue_text: Ormenos muses on his musings, remembering the tale the Sumarkandian witch from the reports on the Wayfarer. Something about a man condemned to roll a boulder up a mountain path, only to always have it roll back down. In the witch's story it was designed to warn of obsession with hopeless tasks, though Ormenos always found an ineffable nobility in the project - then again, perhaps Sister Gate Keeper was right, that madness was simply beginning to sequester his wits; he dared not dwell too long on the possibility.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.X000!MEM.dialogue_text: "And how might I assist you, Brother Inquisitor?"

B.response_text: "I wish to read about the Wayfarer."

C.response_text: "Nothing, I'll just wander around, if that's okay."

D.response_text: "What resources do we have on the Sylvan Architect?"

E.response_text: "I'd only need your assistance if I were studying idiots in the wild."

F.response_text: "Shhhhhhh!!! Be very quiet; I'm hunting gremlins!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.001!MEMO.dialogue_text: "We are awaiting reports from you and the other Thought-Weavers. Not much new has come in since you came last cycle, Brother."

A.response_text: "My report? Well, I may have found the Thought Wheel of the Beginning."

B.response_text: "In that case, I'd like to read about the Wayfarer."

E.response_text: "Seems the only assistance you offer is in wasting time, then."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.002!MEMO.dialogue_text: "Again? Why? Are there any new developments?"

A.response_text: "I might have found the Thought Wheel of the Beginning."

B.response_text: "Yes, but I'm more concerned about the Wayfarer detecting me."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.003!MEMO.dialogue_text: "I see. Then please enjoy your time in the grove, Brother!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.004!MEMO.dialogue_text: "Looking up the history of the Thiuda again, Brother? What is your obsession with the Masters anyway?"

C.response_text: "Not an obsession really; just trying to kill time."

D.response_text: "Obsession?! I merely wish to be informed!"

E.response_text: "Oh, I didn't tell you? Must be because it's none of your business."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.005!MEMO.dialogue_text: "What!? Well... I suppose knowing you makes me an expert on the subject! You shit-eating gremlin!"

A.response_text: "I'm sorry, I shouldn't have said that."

D.response_text: "Journal entry, the first - it postures, using the biggest words it knows..."

E.response_text: "Perhaps shit-eating is a subject better suited to your talents."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0110!MEM.dialogue_text: "This would be the discovery that would cement your place among the Patrons of our Order!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0111!MEM.dialogue_text: "Your form cast in stained glass would watch over the entrance to our halls for centuries to come!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0112!MEM.dialogue_text: "I eagerly await your full report from the Choir!"

A.response_text: "That reminds me, perhaps I should go report to the Choir..."

B.response_text: "What importance does this discovery hold for you?"

E.response_text: "Patron? I'll be king by the time I'm done with this place."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0120!MEM.dialogue_text: "I was under the impression that a Thought-Weaver was invisible to the mind of another... Though, now that I think on it, I do recall a case among the records of Wayfarer investigations related to this..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0121!MEM.dialogue_text: "It's difficult to recall when exactly, given her rather lengthy history with the Order."

A.response_text: "Thank you for your guidance, Brother. I'll go look among the Archives."

B.response_text: "What else can you say on the subject?"

C.response_text: "Okay. Thanks, but I should be leaving now."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0122!MEM.dialogue_text: "Well... Not to sound ominous, but I do recall several Thought-Weavers being assigned to the task of locating the Thought Wheel in rapid succession..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0123!MEM.dialogue_text: "It is... unusual... for Thought-Weavers to retire from a project with such frequency. Most records suggest Thought-Weavers are only replaced in the event of serious illness or... death."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0124!MEM.dialogue_text: "In any event, I imagine that if there were cause for alarm, the Choir would warn you well in advance, Brother."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0125!MEM.dialogue_text: "Glad to help. But I will abuse your time no more!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0126!MEM.dialogue_text: "Enjoy your time in the Grove, Brother. And may your work for the Order be as fruitful as full-grown Muninn!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.013!MEMO.dialogue_text: "...Then I suppose I shall make no further inquiries and abuse your time no more."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0130!MEM.dialogue_text: "Please seek out a Senior Archivist to locate the items you desire, Brother. And enjoy your time in the Grove!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.014!MEMO.dialogue_text: "No need to be so sensitive, Brother. If you do not wish to confide in me, then so be it."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0140!MEM.dialogue_text: "Please seek out a Senior Archivist to locate the items you desire, Brother. And enjoy your time in the Grove!"

D.response_text: "Why so curious, then, Brother?"

E.response_text: "So be it."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.015!MEMO.dialogue_text: "Is that so? Then I apologize for wasting the illustrious Inquisitor's time! Forgive me, wise Thought-Weaver! Bah!"

A.response_text: "I'm sorry, I should not have said that."

D.response_text: "Groveling suits you, Memory Keeper."

E.response_text: "Move along, peasant. I now have both tolerance and time in short supply."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.021!MEMO.dialogue_text: "You haven't yet reported this?! Then you must leave at once, Brother!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0210!MEM.dialogue_text: "The Choir will be displeased that you are neglecting your duties with such a breakthrough hanging on your tongue!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.022!MEMO.dialogue_text: "For me, the individual, no importance; but for me, the loyal servant of our Order, it is everything!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0220!MEM.dialogue_text: "With our knowledge and the Thought Wheel of the Beginning, the will of the Enclave will be nothing short of the rule of law on Earth!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0221!MEM.dialogue_text: "At a mere thought, we will achieve all we could ever hope for!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0222!MEM.dialogue_text: "We will attain even that which we are too truth-blind to now see as our true purpose, Brother!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0224!MEM.dialogue_text: "Thus, I will abuse your time no more! Enjoy the Grove, Brother and congratulations!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0225!MEM.dialogue_text: "Oh and may your work for the Order be as fruitful as a full-grown Muninn!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.024!MEMO.dialogue_text: "Is curiosity not the norm among those of our ilk?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0240!MEM.dialogue_text: "It would be stranger were I not curious about your motivations!"

C.response_text: "True, but I'll keep my reasons to myself."

D.response_text: "...What would you say if you knew the Sylvan Architect were real?"

E.response_text: "And I'm curious about why you're wasting my time."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0242!MEM.dialogue_text: "The most radical of them claim to have found incontrovertible proof that the Sylvan Architect was real, that It manipulates us from the shadows to this day!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0243!MEM.dialogue_text: "These Archives are vast indeed, so I would not doubt that such a memory could be found among the innumerable tomes of our Muninn Grove... But is the source reliable?"

D.response_text: " 'Just as a shadow is not the caster, so too is the caster not its essence'..."

E.response_text: "Is this what you bottom-feeders spend your time musing about?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0244!MEM.dialogue_text: "Forbidden verses from the Biraculian mystics of your hometown, I presume..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0245!MEM.dialogue_text: "There is wisdom in those words; wisdom of a dark and sanity-thieving nature..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!0.0246!MEM.dialogue_text: "We are at the precipice of Awareness, Brother; stare not at length, lest it begin to stare back at you..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.000!MEMO.dialogue_text: "Well, if it isn't the wise Brother Inquisitor, come to cast his derisive gaze upon our squalid grove..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0000!MEM.dialogue_text: "What great tragedy would drive one so illustrious to visit the most 'useless' of Enclavean achievements?"

B.response_text: "The grove is useful; that's why I'm here."

D.response_text: "The utility of a tool depends on the user, does it not?"

E.response_text: "You are undoubtedly useless; the grove, at least, could be used as firewood."

F.response_text: "Actually, I just kinda wandered in here..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.001!MEMO.dialogue_text: "Passive aggression? Those were not my designs!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0010!MEM.dialogue_text: "I merely wished to say that I hope you don't darken our grove for long with the shadow of ignorance!"

A.response_text: "If I offended you, I'm truly sorry, Brother."

B.response_text: "Isn't it more ignorant to ignore your peers' opinions?"

E.response_text: "Quit being such a sulky twit."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.00101!ME.dialogue_text: "Oh, no offense taken; truth-blind opinions concern me not."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.00102!ME.dialogue_text: "Is it not greater ignorance to pay heed to misguided thoughts, Brother?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.001020!M.dialogue_text: "I'm hardly egalitarian when it comes to truth, and though you're all blind to it, it is still truth!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.00105!ME.dialogue_text: "Why...! You dare insult me in my own house? I will not stand for it!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.002!MEMO.dialogue_text: "Oh! So even to a belly-crawler of the Huginn Swamp, the Muninn trees hold some value?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0020!MEM.dialogue_text: "We are fortunate indeed to have your charitable patronage!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0021!MEM.dialogue_text: "Just please do not remain long, as I'd rather not find out if truth-blindness is infectious."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0030!MEM.dialogue_text: "Though, perhaps the Huginn Swamp is a more fitting place for the great Ormenos to slither around."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.004!MEMO.dialogue_text: "...Well, I ask then: how could we have made tools without the memory of our forebearers' efforts?!"

D.response_text: "Necessity is the mother of invention, not memory."

E.response_text: "You already lost one debate today, moron."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.005!MEMO.dialogue_text: "Tread lightly, Inquisitor... I'm in no mood to suffer your insults..."

A.response_text: "I was wrong to say that; I apologize, Brother."

D.response_text: "Well, in truth, the Muninn's are genuinely remarkable and useful."

E.response_text: "Is that so? Then enjoy them instead, you idiot."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0051!MEM.dialogue_text: "Good. Now, try not to drool on the trees while you're here, and leave as soon as your business is concluded."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0054!MEM.dialogue_text: "...Just try not to drool on the trees while you're here, and leave as soon as your business is concluded."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.006!MEMO.dialogue_text: "Wandered? Perhaps you mean slithered? Fitting for a Huginn Swamp creeper, indeed..."

F.response_text: "Where there be swamps, there be gremlins!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.014!MEMO.dialogue_text: "It may well be, but I tell you that our loss of the memories on cloudstone creation, casting both near and far, Thought Wheel genesis and all other Vanquished Techne is tragic beyond all words precisely because our need is not what enables us to make these tools!"

C.response_text: "True, but if all we did was remember, who would make tools?"

D.response_text: "Well, the Huginn folk are doing a good job of rediscovering these secrets."

E.response_text: "Ironic, that you too will die alone and forgotten."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0140!MEM.dialogue_text: "Well... Well... Who's to say that we need any tools?! Perhaps what nature provided us with is enough! Maybe an excessive desire for more tools led to the Vanquished's demise!"

D.response_text: "Then perhaps it's time you abandoned the Order and lived like a cave savage..."

E.response_text: "I tire of your infantile obstinance."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0141!MEM.dialogue_text: "I... I simply don't have time for this!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0142!MEM.dialogue_text: "When your business is concluded, I hope that you'll no longer seek to rot our trees with your ignorance! Good day!"

F.response_text: "Do you doubt Stalphos Gremlinsbane's word!?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0160!MEM.dialogue_text: "I wouldn't dream of it!! No, to be sure, I've read terrible tales of the gremlin folk!"

F.response_text: "Then you too are committed to their extermination?!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0161!MEM.dialogue_text: "Oh, certainly! I've searched my whole life for another who recognized the gremlin menace!"

F.response_text: "Well, then Brother, you've found your kindred slayer!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0162!MEM.dialogue_text: "But alas, I've yet to locate the soiled nest of the Gremlin King... For even our vast grove of memories seems to record little information on this nefarious Master of Shadows!"

F.response_text: "You... are so wise in the ways of gremlins!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0163!MEM.dialogue_text: "One would hope! I've dedicated my life to two things and two things alone!"

F.response_text: "Clearly, one is to dope haircuts, but what's the other?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0164!MEM.dialogue_text: "Nay, Brother! The first is the archiving and preservation of memories for posterity!"

F.response_text: "By Roostor's Comb! Such a noble - albeit boring - deed!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0165!MEM.dialogue_text: "And the second is wiping the gremlin race and any memory thereof from time and space!"

F.response_text: "Be still my beating heart!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0166!MEM.dialogue_text: "Then, Brother, will you aid me on my quest? I feel as though destiny now knocks at our door, and we must answer its call! We should leave immediately!"

A.response_text: "I could use someone to watch my back... or as gremlin fodder..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0167!MEM.dialogue_text: "Then it is agreed? Let's make preparations!"

F.response_text: "TALLY HO!"

B.response_text: "Only fools think twice before they act!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!1.0169!MEM.dialogue_text: "Then, I suppose... I must wait. And the world too must wait to be liberated from the malevolent shadow of our gremlin overlords!"

F.response_text: "Oh, it won't be long! TALLY HO!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!2.002!MEMO.dialogue_text: "Welcome to the light of hope that grants sight to the truth-blind and illuminates the Path of Discipline!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!MUNINN GROVE!2.004!MEMO.dialogue_text: "And how may I be of assistance to you, Brother Inquisitor?"

B.response_text: "I wish to read about the Wayfarer."

C.response_text: "Nothing, I'll just wander around, if that's okay."

D.response_text: "What resources do we have on the Sylvan Architect?"

E.response_text: "I'd only need your assistance if I were studying idiots in the wild."

F.response_text: "Shhhhhhh!!! Be very quiet; I'm hunting gremlins!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: Each step, every heartbeat, time stretches the distance between them, subdividing into vanishing segments. Nested among every slowing tick of the clock, space expands to fill the infinite spans. Soon, Ormenos is left with only the haziest of impressions of his surroundings.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.0010!DESC.dialogue_text: Aromatics spicing the air relax the weary mage; the dull glow of a crystalline candelabra casts just the faintest light; the rhythmic beats of scattered percussionists and the melodic lull of the strings sooth an aching mind.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.00100!DES.dialogue_text: Stumbling over a hill of throw pillows, Ormenos takes a dive through the ground, sinking deeply into a viscous ether. Ever-deeper, the light fades, and along with it all sorrow, worry, excitation, anticipation, and emotion. A hypnotic wave of pure energy washes away the stains of the imagined, leaving behind only that which is. As though in a profound sleep, but with an unparalleled awareness, the perceiver dreams the waking life for years, millennia, eons.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.X0011!DES.dialogue_text: Emerging from the sea of cleansing ether the revived consciousness witnesses its physical form, the Falseflesh it had apparently left behind, now reclining among the throw pillows and alongside a kindred spirit, of countenance so relaxed, so unperturbed as to be unrecognizable as human, a mirror image made flesh. The Sister image peers back, deep into his truth, and smiles.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.0012!DESC.dialogue_text: The communion continues, wordless, yet with equal intensity. It is this forgotten companionship this place revives, the fuel that feeds mind's fire, a dangerous conflagration that threatens to envelop the perceiver who gazes at length...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.0013!DESC.dialogue_text: And with this thought, all thought ceases and Ormenos drifts into a peaceful and actionless state where he simply is and no longer does.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.002!DESCR.dialogue_text: Ormenos once more enters the Scriptorium and thus the state of desireless being, the state that lonely part of him has so longed for. His Trueflesh bathes in the immaculate fusion of his senses as he breathes in the spicy aromatics, internalizes the musical vibrations and releases his hands from the reins of his mind.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.X0020!DES.dialogue_text: As he once more emerges from the transition of his Trueflesh into the realm of passionless reality, he finds himself staring anew into the mirror image of his Brother, a reflection made flesh.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.0021!DESC.dialogue_text: The communion continues, wordless, yet with equal intensity. It is this forgotten companionship this place revives, the fuel that feeds mind's fire, a dangerous conflagration that threatens to envelop the perceiver who gazes at length...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.0022!DESC.dialogue_text: But the journey to his current state was somehow... different. Emotions persisted, fears, insecurities, leaden weights dragging Ormenos down into the depths. In truth, Ormenos is incapable of delving into his usual state of deep relaxation. Thought remains; action remains; Ormenos remains.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.0023!DESC.dialogue_text: Sufficiency begets contentment, and the mage now realizes it is not without reason that the Choir demands caution, and that the Brothers and Sisters of the Enclave are discouraged from entering too frequently.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.0024!DESC.dialogue_text: It is thus that an unrequited Ormenos rises from his seat, a little less cloud-like than before, and glides towards the door, soon to re-enter the no less real, but much less inviting, world of desires.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.003!DESCR.dialogue_text: Now growing perhaps too accustomed to this state of physical and spiritual intoxication, Ormenos is no longer as affected as he once was. He walks in and sees a room, devoid of all things but a massive, luminescent emerald casting its eldritch light upon the faces of mesmerized magi, heads perched upon uneven stones of the coarsest grain.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.0030!DESC.dialogue_text: But are these magi slave to this crystalline overlord, or do they merely pledge allegiance to an inspirational artifact? Great theories discovered, impossible connections made, progress itself seems to be intimately tied to this Scriptorium and its work of Vanquished artifice.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.0031!DESC.dialogue_text: Yet a haunting suspicion pricks Ormenos, warning not all is as it should be... A flash of insight drives him to the unformed questions the situation begs: Who placed this crystal here and to what end? What are the contents of the crystal and why do they seek to elicit a blank state from the visiting magi? In this Scriptorium, who are the writers and who are the tomes?

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!1.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Sufficiency begets contentment, and Ormenos knows when he has had his fill. In truth, it is precisely this lack of avarice for respite that defines all the magi of the Order. Without effort, there is no motion; without motion, there is stagnation.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!1.002!DESCR.dialogue_text: Ormenos will leave the illiterati to their fruitless superstitions, to their woefully incomplete paths. He seeks to do what the historical Biracul never could: to mend the broken path of Awareness, to light the way to understanding with the myriad torches of knowledge.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!1.003!DESCR.dialogue_text: Desire then extends her hand, plucking Ormenos from his cloud-like seat. The half-dazed mage then floats towards the door and back towards the no less real, but much less inviting, world of endless appetites.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!1.010!DESCR.dialogue_text: Sufficiency begets contentment... Yet, despite having had more than his fill of this dreary den, Ormenos is anything but content. He drags crestfallen feet toward the exit, the cruel reality of the Scriptorium now forever in tow.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!2.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Rage? Disillusion? Insanity? Ormenos struggles to name the trigger, the spark that will destroy the crystal. He well knows the explosion will be fatal, and with a crystal this large, this wing of the Archives will return to dust before its sound even reaches the magi in the Mathetia...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!2.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: Like stepping off a cliff only to realize it was a bad idea, Ormenos awakens in a Falseflesh no longer under his control. All he can do now is observe as his world collapses around him.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!2.002!DESCR.dialogue_text: No Techne is needed to summon unparalleled forces; the frailty of an unprotected crystal is its own worst enemy... Odd... Ormenos just now understands that the sheep of the Order are so complacent the Choir never even felt the need to protect this ancient device from destruction.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!2.003!DESCR.dialogue_text: What does that say about him? Could this be the first time he has acted of his own volition? Yet as he acts in ignorance of his motivations, he feels the strings are still attached, but the puppeteer was never even the deceitful Choir...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!2.X004!DESC.dialogue_text: But what does it matter? His hand now grips a rock pillow. It links to the crystal for the briefest instant. The glassy shell shatters, soundlessly, invisibly; for all light, all noise, everything is consumed in the white hot expression of energy that immediately follows. In the space of a thought, the entire Wing of Actuality vanishes. But Ormenos is no longer around to witness this, Falseflesh devoured by the angry expansion of destruction...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!2.005!DESCR.dialogue_text: But what does it matter? His hand now grips a rock pillow. It links to the crystal for the briefest instant. The glassy shell shatters, soundlessly, invisibly; for all light, all noise, everything is consumed in the white hot expression of energy that immediately follows. In the space of a thought, the entire Wing of Actuality vanishes...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!2.0050!DESC.dialogue_text: But of course, faithful to his bond, Luin springs into action. Ormenos' Falseflesh wears the emerald glow promised by a pact he no longer recalls. It protects him from the terrors of obliteration, the flesh-melting heat, and the crushing weight of the collapsing rocks that would erase his very existence.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!2.0051!DESC.dialogue_text: Alas, Ormenos will not survive to see the outcome of his actions, for though Luin is an unparalleled defense, there are assaults it is powerless against. Yet, the mage barely seems to notice the ever-dwindling supply of fresh air, so subtly does it deplete. Time slows as his exhalations grow deeper than their opposite, and he wonders if the plants his Falseflesh will nourish will think him their benefactor...

D.response_text: EIDOS

E.response_text: WULFIAS

F.response_text: EIDOS

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.000!WORD.dialogue_text: "My mirror, my shadow self, cast in relief by the light of Mind's fire."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.001!WORD.dialogue_text: "Commune with me and muse on the Wayfarer."

A.response_text: "She is as us: mirror, reflector of truth, unseen by the eyes."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.002!WORD.dialogue_text: "Many Falsefleshes did she wear; many hands did she use to write; many lifetimes did she travel."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.004!WORD.dialogue_text: "But the part of our whole you examine, she is unique as the heart is to the mind."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.005!WORD.dialogue_text: "Her feet have to the Beginning traveled?"

A.response_text: "Yes, perhaps, but which deeds remain yet unseen?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.006!WORD.dialogue_text: "We may but see with the Eye."

A.response_text: "And if the Mind-Loom weaves us as one?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.009!WORD.dialogue_text: "For from the One we come and to it we return."

A.response_text: "It is only a question of when."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.010!WORD.dialogue_text: "'When' is without significance in the Infinite Spiral..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.000!WORD.dialogue_text: "My mind, my thought made form, cast in relief by the light of Mind's fire."

A.response_text: "We are but reflections of the One."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.002!WORD.dialogue_text: "Dispassionately used until discarded, as hair, as skin, as blood."

A.response_text: "But what is a player without Its pieces?"
"But what are pieces without their player?"
"Then is the player just Fate's piece?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.005!WORD.dialogue_text: "The Infinite Spiral makes of Fate a piece, and of Itself a player."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.006!WORD.dialogue_text: "Yet it too is but a piece, and who could be Its player but Itself?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.008!WORD.dialogue_text: "Finality is an illusion cast by Mind's fire, merely the shadow of genesis!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.009!WORD.dialogue_text: "We are all illusions born of Mind's fire!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SCRIPTORIUM!0.010!WORD.dialogue_text: "'What' is without significance in the Infinite Spiral..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: A blanket of dust rests thick upon all the forgotten residents of this vast chamber, all tucked in for their silent slumber. At the far end, bronze braziers burn tirelessly, casting a smoky wall of haze, nearly obscuring what lies beyond. Vague impressions do make their way through, though, revealing a natural spring cascading down from an outlet in the ceiling. Down it pours, pooling in a shallow well, then bisecting the room as it makes it way to some unseen point of egress. These pristine waters feed a luscious and overgrown garden beyond the smoky wall, only visible due to the several brilliant crystals illuminating the flora with their ghoulish golden glow.

Ormenos casts his gaze into the dusty clutter. Here lie many of the discarded and broken fragments of Vanquished and Thiudan artifacts, untended, unimportant, unwanted. The ancient societies to whom these objects once belonged birthed the magnificent Huginn and Muninn groves; their wisdom gave rise to the Path of Discipline; their diligence amassed the innumerable volumes which line the Great Spiral Path in the Mathetia. And yet here it all lies, in forget's embrace.

Seeing all these abandoned relics of the past, Ormenos cannot help but feel a tinge of futility stain his Enclavean pride. Countless unnamed and unremembered individuals exhausted their life force to yield only feeble fruits, if any at all. He wonders if he will even be worth discarding, like these lifeless scraps, or if his very existence will simply vanish from memory.
A cold jolt slithers down his spine, rippling back up into his shoulders as he casts the ill-omened thought aside. He is here for a reason... if only he could remember what it was.

That dusty scent of forget, that silent slumber of disuse, that hazy veil of brazier smoke masking the unnatural garden beyond... Ormenos has returned to the Seat of the True Archon. Like a name so long unspoken, like a friend so long unremembered, this chamber sits here undisturbed in an abandoned alcove.

But Ormenos remembers. If not why he came, then at least where he has come... This even in spite of never having come here before today. Thinking back, he has no recollect of this place at all, even though he now cannot imagine a world without it. Too many mysteries unsolved, too many questions unanswered. If he could forget this place so thoroughly, what of all his other memories..?

The room seems devoid of activity and all Ormenos can count as companions are the sleeping relics, heavy with the dust of neglect. Yet a number of items do stand out for either their intactness or their lack of a dusty veil - an indicator this area has seen recent use.

Nearby, Ormenos sees a pile of stones, semi-arranged, a copper disk etched with intricate spiraling patterns placed atop. Some ten strides further on, three crystals' reflected brilliance meld together like the dying light of day, one crimson, one violet, and one green. Yet further on, beyond the wall of haze, there is the overgrown garden connected to this area by a simple, stone bridge.

Thought begets decision, leading then to action, yet Ormenos does not move. His feet hold their silence, interrupted by the sound of muffled footsteps approaching at a slow and deliberate pace from the hall.

A.response_text: Wait to see who it is

D.response_text: Hide before they come

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: Stilling his thoughts and steeling his mind, the Thought-Weaver conceals his presence. Stiff as a statue and twice as quiet, he becomes no more conspicuous than any of the forsaken artifacts around him - a trick he knows well, one mastered over countless dives in the Mind-Loom; none can hide in plain sight better than the Inquisitor.

D.response_text: Hide before they come

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: The footfalls quickly morph from shapeless echoes down the hall to sharp stabs on the tiles, and in the space of a thought, a young acolyte enters. Sure in his stride, he walks towards a shrouded artifact near the far corner of the room.

The footfalls quickly morph from shapeless echoes down the hall to sharp stabs on the tiles, and in the space of a thought, the young Thought-Weaver, Babel, enters. Sure in his stride, he walks towards a shrouded artifact near the far corner of the room.
A step before he reaches the shroud, he pauses. Neck twisting enough to look behind, a suspicious eye scans the artifacts.

His shrewd eye belies the appearance of inexperienced youth. Equal parts dark and brilliant, these are the eyes of a survivor. This man has seen things, unspeakable events that would likely drive the best of men mad...
Yet keen as his perception may be, Ormenos is now beyond perception. Nothing short of the Sylvan Architects emerald eyes could spot him.

Seemingly content to chalk it up to his imagination, the wary mage turns back towards his prize, and taking that finally step, arrives thence. Peeling open the shroud just wide enough to fit, he weaves his way underneath and appears to sit upon it, though the shroud obscures the exact nature of his actions.
A flash of blinding light floods the room and in an instant, the human shape beneath the shroud vanishes.

The footfalls quickly morph from shapeless echoes down the hall to sharp stabs on the tiles, and in the space of a thought, a young acolyte enters. Up walks a youthful man, seemingly oblivious of Ormenos at first, as though in a trance...

The footfalls quickly morph from shapeless echoes down the hall to sharp stabs on the tiles, and in the space of a thought, a young acolyte enters. Up walks the young Thought-Weaver, Babel, seemingly oblivious of Ormenos at first, as though in a trance...
The youth's Falseflesh halts its progress, a fact that seems to utterly confuse him. Ormenos clears his throat, an apparent cause for alarm as his new companion tries to jump out of his flesh.
MULTICHECKER

His warnings unheeded, disappointment and pity weigh down the corner's of Babel's mouth. He looks a helpless father witnessing a foolhardy child get punished for a crime they could have avoided. But with a sigh of resignation, Babel leaves the Hall, his purpose for being there still unclear.

Ormenos turns and shuffles away towards his promised destination. Eyes unseen seem to bore holes not through his body, but deep into his Trueflesh. A gaze that writhes like maggots in carrion, scavenging what morsels it can, devouring him from the inside out. Muscles tremble, rippling down his spine. Yet he dare not look back at the source of that stare.

And then, as if in a state of supreme, habitual subordination, Ormenos relinquishes control of his feet, then his legs, and soon every part of his Falseflesh. His meekness and subjugation of will to the Choir acts as a loyal guide, hearkening to the call of duty.

Babel walks up to the shroud, violently peeling it from the object beneath. The crystalline rays of light find no love beneath that shroud, scattering with a brilliant sheen in the six directions, burning Ormenos' eyes with the fury of their flight. A throne, pure and polished mirror-clear, silver in its entirety, light's forgotten nightmare - whereas the deepest black will accept all illumination, this refuses it; whereas the pitchest darkness will marry any errant rays that seek its company, this denies their very existence.
Babel sits upon the lightsbane throne and beckons Ormenos. As if in a trance, the Inquisitor unthinkingly heeds the call, moving to stand upon the copper platform upon which the throne resides.

Now, with a derisive smile, Babel intones the wordless thoughts, invoking a secretive Techne. No brighter could possibly it get, but soon even this simple truth loses certainty. A new shroud of the purest white descends upon the two, disassembling both Falsefleshes, unweaving consciousness...

Ormenos simply returns to his investigations, again surveying the contents of the room. Everything is as it was before, yet it all seems... changed. Though he knows what each item before him is, the myriad fuzzy outlines now shapeshifting before him do little to convince his eyes. Muffled sounds reverberate throughout his skull, the slowed-down steps of a group.

Perception, that fragile messenger of the Falseflesh. Ormenos now knew taste and touch were soon to follow, not gone, but warped. The taste of iron would seem to indicate blood, but it was impossible to tell in the state he was spiraling into. He knew what would happen, where he would end up after this; he had witnessed others on the receiving end of it. So truly bizarre to finally experience it himself. Darkness finally descends on his eyes.

He falls, yet never hits the floor. Oh, surely he had come to a halt - loss of perception does not change reality's dicta. Floating in perpetuity, sound finally disappears, phantom tones swooping in to replace it. The mind's expectation crafts a nightmarish white noise, waves crashes on rocks in an infinite loop. What lies beyond the total loss of perception? He mused.
Madness? Or...
Everything is as it was before the mysterious youth came and vanished, not a speck of dust out of place. The shrouded throne yet abides, silently observing the passage of time.

Nearby, Ormenos sees a pile of stones, semi-arranged, a copper disk etched with intricate spiraling patterns placed atop. Some ten strides further on, three crystals' reflected brilliance meld together like the dying light of day, one crimson, one violet, and one green. Yet further on, beyond the wall of haze, there is the overgrown garden connected to this area by a simple, stone bridge.

Nearby, Ormenos sees the mended stones, their intricately etched copper disk placed atop. Some ten strides further on, three crystals' reflected brilliance meld together like the dying light of day, one crimson, one violet, and one green. Yet further on, beyond the wall of haze, there is the overgrown garden connected to this area by a simple, stone bridge.
MULTICHECKER

Its smooth, coppered surface is scarred with a dizzying pattern of lines, curves and spirals. At the center of the design, a Glyph sits patiently awaiting the silent speech of thought. Yet, though Ormenos knows the symbol has meaning, such knowledge by itself is meaningless - easier to read the Earth's mood from the clouds than to read an unremembered Glyph.\n\n\t\tBeneath the disk are a pile of lazy stones with no urgent desire to seek out their proper order.

The mage bends down to collect a stone. He runs a finger along the six sides, four twice the size of the two ends. Smooth to the touch, except for one irregularity on the back. Turning the specimen over and sideways he notes the presence of a cobalt arrow engraved into the side, marring the perfect continuity of the otherwise flat plane. A glance at its disarrayed companions reveals that all stones share a similar marking.

A.response_text: Arrange all arrows to point away from one another

B.response_text: Arrange them to point in towards each other

C.response_text: Arrange them to point up towards the copper disk

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: Slaying entropy's sloth with an order of his own, Ormenos arranges the stones such that no arrow faces another before replacing the copper disk atop.
Slaying entropy's sloth with an order of his own, Ormenos arranges the stones such that all face one another, and then carefully replaces the copper disk atop.

Ormenos carefully places the stones into the desired alignment, guiding each arrow skyward. When all are in place, an audible click latches onto the bottom of each one, locking them in place. All is as it should be.

Ormenos carefully places the stones into the desired alignment, guiding each arrow skyward in perfect imitation of the stones from the Huginn Grove. When all are in place, an audible click latches onto the bottom of each one, locking them in place. All is as it should be.

Ormenos looks to move the stones, but they politely decline the mage's overtures. Perhaps the Inquisitor would also seek to swap his arms with his legs if he disagrees with where things fit. The mage blushes at the thought. The Phrygian wisemen were right to say, "Unbroken things need not the mending idle minds seek."

Its smooth, coppered surface is scarred with a dizzying pattern of lines, curves and spirals. At the center of the design, a Glyph sits patiently awaiting the silent speech of thought. Yet, though Ormenos knows the symbol has meaning, such knowledge by itself is meaningless - easier to read the Earth's mood from the clouds than to read an unremembered Glyph.

But now with the arrows in their proper alignment, the broken pieces mended and the amethyst crystal powering the device, a Glyph begins to manifest. Curiosity has led Ormenos to tangle with forces he does not comprehend, and now he very much regrets reassembling some abandoned device in ignorance. Fear grips him as he prays to the sacred Wyrm the Jeran mystics for protection.

Air rushes in as Fear suddenly releases its hold on the mage's lungs. As though taking his first breath anew, Ormenos is reborn, now with the knowledge of Nearcasting seared into his Trueflesh. The Glyph tells of its storied past, times it and Ormenos shared. Confusion replaces understanding as Ormenos fathoms the unlikely memories, but the Glyph does not care. Instead, it urges its old friend to make use of it, resonating with the newly reformed Caster.

The choice is made, even before Ormenos can think to make it. Apprehension forces its way in, widening the path for its dread companion Fear. Ormenos does not think it was a choice. He was forced to do it. He is losing control...

And yet still, he wants to go on; he wants to see it through to the end. That is his choice. Recognition of his single power in this utterly helpless state staves off crippling fear. Come what may, he can choose whether or not to go on.
Long before his last thought fades to memory, Ormenos has already conjured the Glyph from the Graylands.
A blinding flash. Falseflesh dissolves; skin and muscles peel away; his bone disintegrates. His Trueflesh is cast off into the unknown...

Having caused irreparable damage to the device with his haphazard additions, Ormenos regrets he did not spend more time in the Huginn and Muninn Groves. Perhaps reckless experimentation does not suit one of the Order. The Phrygian wisemen did say, "Only thorough study can scratch the itch curiosity plagues us with - all other devices draw blood."

Its smooth, coppered surface is scarred with a dizzying pattern of lines, curves and spirals. At the center of the design, a Glyph sits patiently awaiting the silent speech of thought... But silence cracks. A hum becomes a murmur, and this in turn a whisper. A name. The Glyph wordlessly speaks its name, a resonance with the memory of the Trueflesh. Ormenos remembers the inconceivable; he remembers myriad lives, some his, some others. Nested deep within these is the memory of Nearcasting. Soon, the shrouded throne begins to pulse in recognition of Ormenos' inadvertent thought.

D.response_text: Leave. Now.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: MULTICHECKER

Three crystals proudly sparkle with borrowed light, giving the illusion of energetic contents. Alas, all three are inert vessels, long exhausted from centuries of use. The trio are, for the most part, perfectly intact - the emerald the lone exception, owner of a slight chip on its fragile surface.

F.response_text: Break them

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: Three crystals proudly sparkle with borrowed light, giving the illusion of energetic contents. Alas, all three are inert vessels, long exhausted from centuries of use. The trio are, for the most part, perfectly intact - the emerald the lone exception, owner of a slight chip on its fragile surface.

F.response_text: Break them

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: The three crystals no longer steal reflections to mask their once deficient stores of energy. They now brim with the intensity of their own internal energy. Yet the emerald still desires to be unique among its ilk, dangerously vibrating as energy courses through it.

A.response_text: Place one under the metallic disk

F.response_text: Destroy them

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: Thinking back on all he had ever read, seen, or experienced with crystals, Ormenos cautiously deliberates on which to use. The wrong choice may very well spell disaster... Soon, his thoughts turn to all the violent explosions he has seen from crystal misuse... Many his own experiences... But with him as other people... Like the fragments of a dream mistaken for reality...
Before he can make a decision, a Glyph heeds his call... Resurrection... When did he learn that?! Does anyone alive even know it?

Then, the Glyph's effects manifest. Portions of his own vital essence flow into each crystal, returning life to the slumbering gems. His head spins and he hits a knee, needing a moment to recover from the lost energy.

Crushing and fracturing, utterly smashing, and pulverizing the crystalline structures, Ormenos sates a destructive lust he hardly knee he possessed. Indeed, the volatile candy of instant gratification feeds his frenzied crusade against crystals, and soon all that remain are a few scattered shards, hapless survivors crippled in their fragmentation.

Ormenos places the ruby among the stones and replaces the copper disk. But something is clearly amiss, as the disk does not sit evenly upon the crystal, canted as it is. Ormenos attempts to reorient the crystal so that it might sit flush with the copper disk, to no avail.

Ormenos places the emerald among the stones and replaces the copper disk. Heavy metal cracks through the crystal's surface at its defect. In the space of a thought, the entire structure of the crystal succumbs to the pressure, thus releasing a catastrophic wave of energy.

Skin peels from his shell, merging with the raw heat into a shapeless plasma. Muscles and bones quickly expand, seeming to disappear into the white hot surroundings. A Trueflesh not quite his own, but inextricably linked thereto observes, floating, dissipating, searching for a shell in which to reform and continue its journey.
Ormenos places the amethyst among the stones, carefully replacing the copper disk atop, and...
Nothing.
No explosions, no cracking, no deformities, nothing.
The crystal fits flush - not even a hair's breadth between it and the disk. And thus, absence is evidence the choice was true. Clearly, all is as it should be.

The two remaining crystals seem to burst with energy, as though trying to call the mage's attention, as if jealous their violet companion were chosen instead. Still, the chipped emerald vibrates slightly as energy courses through it, seeking to distinguish itself from its rubied cohort.

F.response_text: Destroy them

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: The scattered shards of the glassy prisms he sought to destroy resentfully glare back at him from their final resting place. No hope remains for a broken crystal.

A light mist cast up from the humble cataract spreads a foggy veil around the garden, and the braziers, burning away, do nothing to help sharpen the image of the nebulous vegetation. Indeed, were it not for the brilliant array of crystals bathing the area in ample rays of light, it would be difficult to tell that anything lingered beyond this fog at all.\n\n\t\tCrossing the bridge Ormenos finds himself carving a path through the mist, getting a much clearer look at the shapes it seeks to obfuscate. Braziers, mineral-rich soil, coursing water, colorful floral life unbecoming of the subterranean environs, all combine to yield the most bizarre and unexpected scene Ormenos has come to see in his long time at the Enclave.
Ormenos sees nothing of use to him among this artificial nature, painstakingly engineered for reasons long forgotten.
Inspiration strikes, stunning the mage with its clarity of purpose. As though manipulated by the hand of some haunter in the dark, he is drawn to, no, compelled to collect...

Bending down, the mage scoops both hands towards each other, severing the soil from its filthy brethren. Having collected the dirt, his clarity of purpose fades into the emptiness he has grown accustomed to as of late. Clods of soil cupped in his hand stare up at him asking the same questions he now asks himself. With a sigh he attempts to return the earth from where he divested it, only to realize his Falseflesh will not move.

He tries to look around with eyes frozen in space, observing only the still image before them. The fog remains immobile; the water static in mid-fall; all has stopped, all except for Awareness. Confusion, spiced with terror and impotence, feed Ormenos' chaotic thoughts, promising to grant him his long-awaited inheritance...
The madness he always knew would be his.

Instinct soon becomes will and he cools his burning Awareness in the pool of Discipline. The Mind's Fire will consume it all if unabated, curiosity tempered with control leads to the fruits of wisdom.
Thus, he awaits, frozen in time and space, calm and detached, a mere observer of the fear that consumed him. But what does he await? He and his fistful of dirt...

B.response_text: He spreads it over his body.

C.response_text: He pours it on the copper disk.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: Against his better judgment, Ormenos unites fist and mouth, nary a grain of dark soil escaping his gaping maw. Cheeks swell; lips seal; and teeth begin to mash. Dryness soon replaces moisture; clumps vie for space as he begins sending them to an acidic grave.

His body is most displeased with the decision, retaliation its counterargument. A spasming gut forces the contents of his stomach up whence they came, including the inadvisable recent additions. That slimy chimera of bile and dirt writhes momentarily as it settles back into the ground.
Embarrassed by the absurdity of his actions, Ormenos backs away over the bridge.

Against his better judgment, Ormenos channels the master painter within. Soon he begins ecstatically crafting an unequaled masterpiece of earthen tones upon his fleshy canvas. Ecstasy then become frenzy, manifesting in haphazard spinning. Even while spiraling inward like a leaf in a vortex, his fingers leave broad strokes of dirt lines more complex than the most cryptic Glyphs. The whirling mage spews maniacal laughter, louder with every stroke, until his medium begins to exhaust itself.

Now paintless, he quickly gathers more dirt to continue his bacchanal of earthen art... until, in a flash, he comes to. He is soon painfully aware of the bizarreness of this recent fugue. Hands open, releasing the would-be paint. It hits the ground only transforming back into useless soil once more.

Ormenos ceremoniously carries the dirt toward the copper disk, meticulously spreading it among the loosened stones. A sudden whir follows a violent shake, and soon sparks light up the undulating gaps in its manifold. The device now writhes caught in some fevered rhapsody, as though new life were being breathed into its ancient corpse. And then...
Nothing but silence and stillness.
No sounds, no movement, not even a hint of the promised vigor. The contraption remains inert, unmoving... dead.

Yes, water. But a vessel is needed to tame this elusive prey. He pats the pockets of his coarsely-woven robe finding nothing suitable to the task. Eyes then scan automatically for the tool he lacks, caught almost immediately by the glare from the fragments of a shattered crystal. Long had Ormenos desired to find a memory of crystal reparation among his charges in the Vault; such a Techne relearned would surely change the world, giving new life to pathetic crystals like these... He held the thought as Awareness bloomed within him.

In a beautiful reversal of fortunes, these useless shards regain some semblance of purpose, for a corner piece resides among them. Four sides, unbroken meet in a single corner, giving rise to an empty pyramid. This will well suffice to later port the water to a venue of his choosing!
Thought to will, and will to action, the glassy vessel meets his grasp, whereupon Ormenos returns to collect the water he so desired...

But now what? His clarity of purpose fades into the emptiness he has grown accustomed to as of late. A draught of water stares up at him asking the same questions he now asks himself. With a sigh he attempts to return the water whence he divested it, only to realize his Falseflesh will not move.

He tries to look around with eyes frozen in space, observing only the still image before them. The fog remains immobile; the water static in mid-fall; all has stopped, all except for Awareness. Confusion, spiced with terror and impotence, feed Ormenos' chaotic thoughts, promising to grant him his long-awaited inheritance...
The madness he always knew would be his.

Instinct soon becomes will and he cools his burning Awareness in the pool of Discipline. The Mind's Fire will consume it all if unabated, curiosity tempered with control leads to the fruits of wisdom.
Thus, he awaits, frozen in time and space, calm and detached, a mere observer of the fear that consumed him. But what does he await? He and his cupful of water...

C.response_text: He pours it on the copper disk.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: Ormenos dutifully carries the water to the nearest plant, soon donating each and every drop to the plant...

But, in an undeniable bout of cosmic irony, water begins to fall over the plants from pipe-fed spigots in the ceiling. Clearly the vegetation could have never reached such monstrous levels of growth had it lacked access to water.
Somewhat embarrassed by the futility of his actions, Ormenos backs away over the bridge.
Ormenos hurriedly runs to and fro between the rivulet and the smoke-churning braziers, filling his re-purposed crystalline cup with water and inundating the braziers with its fire-choking baths.

Back and forth, back and forth, a seemingly endless cycle, soon leading him to wonder if these fires would ever die. Yet he continues his flame massacre with all the speed his weak, scholar's legs can muster. Shutting down his conscious awareness of the process, time passes both impossibly fast and interminably slow, and despite this paradoxical nature of maddening unthought, he soon realizes his task is soon done; he has almost extinguished all the braziers, leaving naught but an evanescent memory of the fires they once house. Thought returns as the smoke of the dying embers breathes its final breath.
Now, not even smoke rises from the embers of these stilled fires - and they are not likely to spontaneously restart anytime soon.

Ormenos ceremoniously carries the draught of water toward the copper disk, meticulously sprinkling it among the loosened stones upon arrival. A sudden whir follows a violent shake, and soon sparks light up the undulating gaps in its manifold. The device now writhes caught in some fevered rhapsody, as though new life were being breathed into its ancient corpse. And then...

The braziers draw the mage in with the irresistible pull of their dancing flames, his Mind's Fire resonating with their physical manifestations, ever-intensifying with each approaching step. The two soon merge into a chaotic symphony, their blinding crescendoing seeming to overwhelm his fevered awareness.

Closer, closer, ever closer, until its heat warms, then burns. Closer, closer, all too close, trapped in its hypnotic snare. Warmth mutates becoming burn; should he get any closer, the skin will melt from his Falseflesh. Yet, this Siren ablaze keeps singing to him its seductive song...

Suddenly, silence seals the potent spell, bringing Ormenos to a halt. Relief and terror unite in the revelation that though he no longer moves towards certain destruction, he also realizes his Falseflesh refuses to move at all.

He tries to look around with eyes frozen in space, observing only the still image before them. The fog remains immobile; the water static in mid-fall; all has stopped, all except for Awareness. Confusion, spiced with terror and impotence, feed Ormenos' chaotic thoughts, promising to grant him his long-awaited inheritance...
The madness he always knew would be his.

Instinct soon becomes will and he cools his burning Awareness in the pool of Discipline. The Mind's Fire will consume it all if unabated, curiosity tempered with control leads to the fruits of wisdom.
Thus, he awaits, frozen in time and space, calm and detached, a mere observer of the fear that consumed him. But what does he await? He and the blaze before him...

A.response_text: He extracts an ember from the brazier.

C.response_text: He casts its embers upon the copper disk.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: Ormenos recklessly draws a coal from the bowels of the smoking vessel. His supple flesh burns. Agony manifests in wailing sobs and violent convulsions.

As the initial shock wanes, he regains control over his rogue musculature. Gripping his damaged hand with the untainted one, he lifts himself up. Gradually, and much to his surprise, the pain vanishes until nothing remains. Absent the hideous imprint of the devilish coal upon his palm, Ormenos would never even suspect that he had been foolish enough to reach into a brazier to play with fire.
Now, somewhat embarrassed by his behavior, Ormenos backs away over the bridge.

Ormenos' weak, scholar's legs deal swift and pitiful punishment to the braziers at the point of his heel. Only with a great effort does he succeed in knocking its blazing contents sloppily upon the ground. The soil's moisture slowly robs them of their heat, suffocating the flames. Brilliant yellows become tame crimsons until they inevitably fizzle out. Charred corpses of ashen gray now lie unburied, scattered, unmourned.

Carefully covering his hands with the tattered edges of his sleeves, Ormenos ceremoniously carries the brazier toward the copper disk. Upon arrival, he casts its embers among the loosened stones. Heat sinks into the pieces, liquefying the flat edges of each. The edges meld, uniting individuals into groups, and ultimately groups into a single unit. A memory vaguely floats across the background of consciousness, something about heat and the self-healing properties of ancient artifacts. But alas, this seed of thought never fully blossoms.

Then, in the space of a thought, a sputtering sound and a violent shaking possess the contraption. The whirring crescendos pounding at the ears; the trembling escalates cracking the newly-healed stones. These frenzied oscillations, these roaring groans, they remind Ormenos of something...

Memory cracks serenity's seals, bringing a flood of terror with it. Past insight tells that these are all the signs of unstable energy nearing a point of no return, like a cracking crystal. Further weakening of the device's inner structure would spell his doom.
Shock and despair grip his lungs, sealing off the airways. The machine maintains its violent convulsions and deafening rumble.
An immeasurable span of time elapses, slowly draining the pent up energy, allowing it to peacefully dissipate. The machine converges to silence and stillness.
Relief and exhaustion force air back into his shriveled lungs. The result of his ill-advised meddling with forces he ill understands has been mercifully benign.

Carefully covering his hands with the tattered edges of his sleeves, Ormenos ceremoniously carries the brazier toward the copper disk. Upon arrival, he casts its embers among the loosened stones. Heat sinks into the pieces, liquefying the flat edges of each. The edges meld, uniting individuals into groups, and ultimately groups into a single unit. A memory vaguely floats across the background of consciousness, something about heat and the self-healing properties of ancient artifacts.
Scrutinize as he may, all Ormenos sees is a throne with a shroud atop.

Scrutinize as he may, all Ormenos sees is a throne with a shroud atop. Disappointment begins to overrule curiosity, and his sullen gaze falls to the floor. There, the familiar reddish sheen of a Nearcaster greets his eyes, for how could he forget that copper seal?
...Forget?

Confusion comes to dominate the war of emotions as he thinks on this bizarre memory. Conscious effort bears no fruits in revealing its source. Perhaps he learned it from one of the countless dives into the Vault-dweller's minds. Yet, he feels it is distinctly his own. Visions of assembling the contraption come and go, fading into the haze of half-conjured memory.
But this line of thought is getting him nowhere. The throne's true purpose now deciphered, he must choose how to proceed.
The room's items remain unchanged. But Babel is of course nowhere to be seen - though the shrouded throne in which he disappeared yet abides, silently observing the passage of time.
Ormenos turns to leave, sparing one last glance for the shrouded throne before pressing forward.
A violent explosion sends shrapnel tearing through Ormenos' Falseflesh. Blood gushes out from the countless wounds, myriad mirror simulacra of the natural spring not two steps away.
With the exodus of blood comes a blurring of the senses, a mixing of all thoughts and emotion, coalescing into a singular and pure finality of intention...
In the end, all the mage wonders is whether he will be remembered.

A violent explosion sends shrapnel careening towards Ormenos more swiftly than his Falseflesh can register the fear of death. An unwarranted fear, considering his pact with the emerald spawn, now distant in both time and space...
"No ordinary armor am I! Of the forge of Vanargand am I!"
"...an unyielding shield I will be!"
"As armor, my form is impenetrable! Your Falseflesh shall bear my protection upon its very skin!"

Before Awareness completes the circle, a break in the line occurs. Fog rolls in over the clarity he once held, taking with it the forms it obscures, subsuming everything into a single, indecipherable unit.

Skin shining with an emerald glow, Ormenos comes to. Now aware that he is caught mid-explosion, yet remains unharmed. What trick of the Masters is this that he can so inexplicably evade Death's scythe? Have the cosmic titans not yet tired of playing his piece?

Perhaps all is always as it should be. Ormenos is destined to survive, regardless of his will. A shock wave roars at him, slamming the mage violently into some unseen surface. Consciousness drains from his weakened Falseflesh...

Upon waking, he believes to witness himself connected to a Mind-Loom, with a Thought-Weaver clearly trying to extract from him a memory. Impossible. That could never happen to him. He falls back into a state of darkness.
Waking from another half-dream, this time he sees the destroyed chamber growing smaller and more distant. Looking up, he sees two Enforcers dragging him away from the scene.
Reality and chance are one in the same to him now, and he knows not which to choose.
But perhaps he need not choose at all, as darkness mercifully descends upon him, bringing with it a dreamless sleep...
MULTICHECKER
"Aaaahh! You scared the ghost right from me!"
"Wha... Why are you here, Brother Inquisitor? Aren't you supposed to be in the Nave giving your report"

A.response_text: "That I should! Thanks for the reminder!"

D.response_text: "...I was just on my way there, actually!"

E.response_text: "I go where I please, when I please."

F.response_text: "Shhh! Don't scare it away!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "It's my pleasure! Wouldn't want the most esteemed member of our caste falling from the Choir's good graces..."
"I mean, we've all heard the whispers about the Choir's 'severity'..."

A.response_text: "Oh? You really are a Thought-Weaver to the marrow, then..."

B.response_text: "Whispers are oft only half-heard and half-true, at best."

E.response_text: "Cowards whisper; men speak."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "Ah, yes! Whispered words oft go unheard, but we Thought-Weavers seek even the tiniest echo of information!"

A.response_text: "Someday you'll make a fine Loom Master."

B.response_text: "Just remember to consider the source with care."

E.response_text: "You presume too much; you're not yet a full Thought-Weaver!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "Thank you for your kind words, Brother. May the Choir sing favorably for you."
"Wise words I'll carry close to my heart! Thank you for the lesson, Brother."
