"I hope the Choir sings favorably for you - and for the good of the Order!"

A.response_text: "Yes, for the good of the Enclave."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "Of course! Just as the wisdom of Phrygia cautions, 'Whispered words poison unthinking minds...'"
"...You're a scholar of Phrygian aphorisms, then? Rare to find one beyond the Undefiled Lands..."
"Truth well spoken, but it's a rare breed who will choose foreign guides..."
"What of the wisemen of Jer?"

A.response_text: "If wisdom existed in Jer, I wouldn't have left."

B.response_text: "How did you know I was from Jer?"

E.response_text: "Honestly, I don't have time for this."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "Might have something to do with the Cults Morticarum..."
"Sister Midnight cornered me the other day asking about my Zemeian heritage and any information related to the Cults... I had no idea they existed outside the Undefiled Lands."
"For centuries, cult activity has gnawed away at the memory of our Phrygian forefathers, replacing courage with blind fear and wisdom with willful ignorance. It's even..."
"...Well, the truth is a little... embarrassing..."

B.response_text: "Personal reasons? I suppose I'll be on my way, then."

E.response_text: "Well, doesn't matter; I need to get going anyway."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "Well, you're actually the reason I decided to become a Thought-Weaver in the first place..."

"Of all the Seniors of all the castes, only one person's name was always mentioned as a paragon of Discipline. And when they gave you the Wayfarer, everyone said you'd be the one to solve her, that you'd find the Thought Wheel of the Beginning..."
"I was and still am amazed by everyone's confidence in you..."
"Oh, I'm sorry! Not in a bad way! That's not what I meant! I meant it in a good way!"
"I was just so excited to speak with you that I forgot all about your report!"
"I'll delay you no longer! For the good of the Enclave!"
"Yes, of course, Brother. I apologize for my misspeech. May the Choir sing favorably for you."
"Is there a problem with the truth?"

A.response_text: "No, you're right. Thanks for helping clear my head."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "Reciprocate? Why would they?"
"The Choir only tells us what we need to know, when we need to know it... If we're the Enclave's limbs, the Choir is the mind, directing us better than we could direct ourselves."

A.response_text: "Perhaps you're right. I'll just go give the report."

B.response_text: "You'd so readily give up your agency?"

C.response_text: "If I go, will you stop proselytizing?"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "Yes, I would!"
"I mean, isn't that why we're all here in the first place? Didn't we all come here to be part of something greater than ourselves?"
"The only way to do that is to have faith in our leaders!"
"It's just like the Phrygian wisemen say, 'A lone cog will never itself become a machine...'."

A.response_text: "You're right, Brother. I'll go give the report."

E.response_text: "You be a cog; I'll be the human running the machine."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "Then you've studied the Phrygian aphorisms? And yet still you don't understand their meaning?"

A.response_text: "No, you're right; the will of many outweighs the will of one."

B.response_text: "We understand Biracul, but do not follow his religion..."

E.response_text: "Just because dead men said it doesn't make it true."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "But even that false prophet saw the wisdom in unity."
"Do you have reason to suspect the Choir, Brother Inquisitor?"
"...Perhaps, I'd misjudged you. I didn't think so much time among the Vault-dwellers would make you want to become one."
"But yours is the right to choose. Farewell, Ormenos."
"But, are we not at our best when in service to each other and the Choir, Brother?"

A.response_text: "If I go, will you stop proselytizing?"

D.response_text: "Since when do Junior magi instructor their seniors?"

E.response_text: "Soon you will all serve only me."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "Apologies, Brother. I spoke out of turn."
"I just find your lack of faith in the Choir and your fellow Enclaveans... disheartening."
"But then again, all is always as it should be. Farewell, Ormenos."
"...Scare what away?"

F.response_text: "THE JADE MONKEY, YOU FOOL!!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "The... what?"

F.response_text: "YOU IGNORAMUS, IT'S THE MOST VALUABLE OF ALL JEWELED MONKEYS!!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "If you're afraid of scaring it away, should you be yelling?"

F.response_text: "JADE STATUES CAN'T HEAR! BY BIRACUL'S BALLS, YOU'RE DENSE!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "Indeed, how could I not have known?"

F.response_text: "Maybe 'cause sarcasm is worse for objectivity than beer, cheeky bastard!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "Indeed... In any case, Brother, I suggest you make your way to the Nave; the Choir is likely awaiting your report."

F.response_text: "Look, I hafta find this Jade Monkey for a quest in another book, so..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "Then you don't plan on reporting at all...?"

F.response_text: "Not unless they're giving out free Jade Monkeys there..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "I'm at a loss for words..."

F.response_text: "...Except for the ones you just used to express that thought..."
"And that's a genuine loss of words!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "Yes... well, then I hope the Choir sings favorably for you, Brother!"
"Aaaahh! You scared the ghost right from me!"
"Wha... Why are you here, Brother Inquisitor? Aren't you supposed to be in the Nave giving your report?"

B.response_text: "Why try to hide that you're the Prime Archon?"

D.response_text: "As you command, Prime Archon Babel..."

E.response_text: "I go where I please, when I please."

F.response_text: "Shhh! Don't scare it away!"

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SEAT OF THE TRUE ARCHON.dialogue_text: "Brother Inquisitor's keen sense of awareness has taken me aback..."
"That you even know a Prime Archon exists is... surprising... to say the least."
"I suppose we have no choice, then. Follow me."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.001!DES.dialogue_text: Light itself seems to have forsaken this place. A mere ten steps down a dubious spiral of stairs and shadows already blanket everything, thick and absolute like an inverse blizzard. Yet still he descends, each footfall carefully silenced. Though vision fails him, his ears help pick out the dimensions of the passage. Drops of condensation pour a periodic rain, slicking the steps and walls. Their echoes talk to the mage's ears, eager to reveal gossip not oft heard. It appears the passage is far wider than necessary to accommodate a single mage - likely, five linked arm in arm would not want for room - and far taller than the discretion required for a secret passage. But even still, Ormenos sticks close to the wall, fingers sliding along the damp stones.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0010!DE.dialogue_text: Soon, a subdued amber light gradually begins to fill Ormenos' severely dilated pupils. He wipes water from his eyelashes to kill the fuzzy, rainbow glares, and cautiously creeps towards the light. Before long, he enters a lair illuminated by a massive array of crystals.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0011!DE.dialogue_text: Shock and terror war across his face, as projections of enormous sea snakes, skinned wolves, and myriad other half-finished horrors dance mid-air before him. A persistent sense of dread tears at the tattered frays of his sanity, threatening to pull him under. But he is used to this by now. He can beat it; he must persevere.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0012!DE.dialogue_text: Among the scattered specters and various artifacts are objects more mundane. A chair here, a workbench there. He grounds himself in their banality, only to find their dimensions are no trick of perspective. Every table, every stool, everything is massive, fit for a form of equal proportions.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0013!DE.dialogue_text: Then, he feels it: light tremors, rhythmic and dull at first, though soon growing in intensity. Across the way, a massive opening shrieks forth crunchy echoes, the slow pounding of wood on stone creeping up from the depths. The door is far from where Ormenos stands, and the chamber's crystals afford it no illumination. But suddenly, light appears among the shadows, bobbing in time with the tremors.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0014!DE.dialogue_text: Ever-greater the quakes, ever-brighter the light, the mage hesitates, wondering if curiosity will be the end of him.

D.response_text: This will shatter his mind!

E.response_text: Only a coward would run.

F.response_text: Meh. It's just Vanargand in a tree suit.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0015!DE.dialogue_text: Ormenos steels himself, driven to witness this eldritch terror, even if it drives him insane. Up until now, he has been able to wrest his sanity from the grips of chaos, but all this changes the moment he sees the shadow climbing up from the depths.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.00150!D.dialogue_text: In that instant, Ormenos feels a fear well beyond the fear of death. Death would be merciful. No, this is the fear of the deathless, of those who cannot die. He has seen what should not have been seen. Now, the negative image of that shadow is burned into his Trueflesh, never to be forgotten. Now, its curse is seared into his very being, corrupting his grasp on reality, morphing perception beyond human ken.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.00151!D.dialogue_text: Now, he is condemned to life with undying memory.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0016!DE.dialogue_text: His courage breaks and his psyche splinters. He falls to his knees and begins a desperate crawl back up the stairs. Pitiful whimpers leak through his trembling lips, the shadows of strangled screams too weak to come out from hiding. Time seems to stretch and all memory fades...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.00160!D.dialogue_text: Except for the one memory of that shadow.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0017!DE.dialogue_text: Shocked at how calm he feels, Ormenos begins to skip back up the steps, away from the pain of reality. As he skips, he whistles a tune he remembers from a Gleebringer back in Tambul... Akkeber was his name. Maybe that guy wasn't so bad after all...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.002!DES.dialogue_text: Light seems to have forgotten this place. It is a mere ten steps down a dubious spiral of stairs and shadows already blanket everything, thick and absolute like an inverse blizzard. Yet still Ormenos descends, following the faint footfalls Babel leaves to guide him. Though vision fails here, sound helps pick out the dimensions of the passage. In addition to the rhythmic sounds of their feet, drops of condensation pour a periodic rain, slicking the steps and walls. Their echoes talk to the mage's ears, eager to reveal gossip not oft heard. It appears the passage is far wider than necessary to accommodate the two magi - likely, five linked arm in arm would not want for room - and far taller than the discretion required for a secret passage. But even still, Ormenos sticks close to the wall, fingers sliding along the damp stones, chasing after his invisible leader.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0020!DE.dialogue_text: Soon, a subdued amber light gradually begins to fill Ormenos' severely dilated pupils. He wipes water from his eyelashes to kill the fuzzy, rainbow glares, and cautiously creeps towards the light. Before long, he follows Babel into a lair illuminated by a massive array of crystals.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0021!DE.dialogue_text: Shock and terror war across his face, as projections of enormous sea snakes, skinned wolves, and myriad other half-finished horrors dance mid-air before him. A persistent sense of dread tears at the tattered frays of his sanity, threatening to pull him under. But he is used to this by now. He can beat it; he must persevere. A derisive smirk curls Babels lips as he motions with his head to look again at the room.

Ormenos grounds himself in their banality, only to find their dimensions are no trick of perspective. Every table, every stool, everything is massive, fit for a form of equal proportions.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0023!DE.dialogue_text: Then, he feels it: light tremors, rhythmic and dull at first, though soon growing in intensity. Across the way, a massive opening shrieks forth crunchy echoes, the slow pounding of wood on stone creeping up from the depths. The door is far from where Ormenos stands, and the chamber's crystals afford it no illumination. But suddenly, light appears among the shadows, bobbing in time with the tremors.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0024!DE.dialogue_text: Ever-greater the quakes, ever-brighter the light, the mage hesitates, wondering if curiosity will be the end of him.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0025!DE.dialogue_text: Yet Ormenos steels himself, driven to witness this eldritch terror, even if it drives him insane. Up until now, he has been able to wrest his sanity from the grips of chaos, but all this changes the moment he sees the shadow climbing up from the depths.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0026!DE.dialogue_text: In that instant, Ormenos feels a fear well beyond the fear of death. Death would be merciful. No, this is the fear of the deathless, of those who cannot die. He has seen what should not have been seen. Now, the negative image of that shadow is burned into his Trueflesh, never to be forgotten. Now, its curse is seared into his very being, corrupting his grasp on reality, morphing perception beyond human ken.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0027!DE.dialogue_text: Now, he is condemned to life with undying memory.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.X0028!D.dialogue_text: Babel's grin now splits his face, baring the chattering teeth of a madman.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.X0029!D.dialogue_text: Ormenos stares stupidly at Babel, as if only now seeing him for the first time. Caught between his fear of what approaches and of the man in front of him, he is utterly speechless.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.003!DES.dialogue_text: Despair seeps into him like water into a sinking ship, and soon every fiber of his being is getting pulled into the abyss. He falls to his knees and begins a desperate crawl back up the stairs. Pitiful whimpers leak through his trembling lips, the shadows of strangled screams too weak to come out from hiding.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0030!DE.dialogue_text: Babel steps in front, barring his way. In the space of a thought, the Prime Archon's hand rests flush against Ormenos' forehead.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0031!DE.dialogue_text: Time seems to stretch and all memory fades, save the shadow.

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.0032!DE.dialogue_text: But before long, a dreamless sleep removes even this from consciousness, and Ormenos...

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.000!BAB.dialogue_text: "So you see, Brother Inquisitor, sometimes ignorance truly is bliss."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.001!BAB.dialogue_text: "What you've uncovered wasn't meant for us mortals to uncover."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.X002!BA.dialogue_text: "I too had this misfortune, but at least I've the strength to stand up to it."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.003!BAB.dialogue_text: "But don't worry, Brother. I seek to destroy it, to bring freedom to our beloved Order..."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.004!BAB.dialogue_text: "Even if it costs my life in exchange."

ENCLAVE!ARCHIVES!SYLVAN REFUGE!0.005!BAB.dialogue_text: "But for now, we must get you to a place where you can rest your tired mind..."
